119.T.B.Irving: Then your Lord-for those who had done evil out of ignorance, then repented later on and reformed-your Lord was afterward Forgiving, Merciful.

120.T.B.Irving: Abraham formed a community that was devoted to God since he was righteous and was no associator;

121.T.B.Irving: grateful for His favors, He chose and guided him to a Straight Road.

122.T.B.Irving: We gave him a fine thing in this world, and he will be among the honorable in the Hereafter.

123.T.B.Irving: Then we inspired you: "Follow the sect of Abraham the Seeker; he was no associator [of others in his worship of God]."

124.T.B.Irving: The Sabbath was set up only for those who disagreed about it. Your Lord will pass judgment on them on Resurrection Day concerning what- ever they have been disagreeing about.

125.T.B.Irving: Invite [people] to your Lord´s way with discretion and kindly instruction, and discuss [things] with them in the politest manner. Your Lord is quite Aware as to who has strayed from His path, just as He is quite Aware of those who have consented to be guided.

126.T.B.Irving: If you (all) should punish them, then do your punishing to the same extent as you have been punished. Yet if you are patient, well [things go] better for the patient.

127.T.B.Irving: Act patient; your patience comes only from God. Do not feel saddened because of them nor be in any anguish over how they plot.

128.T.B.Irving: God stands alongside those who fulfill their duty and who act kindly!

1.T.B.Irving: Glory be to Him Who had His servant travel by night from the Hallowed Mosque to the Further Mosque whose surroundings We have blessed, so We might show him some of Our signs! He is the Alert, the Observant!

2.T.B.Irving: We gave Moses the Book and granted it as guidance for the Children of Israel: "Do not accept any defender except Me!"

3.T.B.Irving: [They were] offspring [of those] whom We put on board with Noah; he was a grateful servant.

4.T.B.Irving: We decreed in the Book concerning the Children of Israel: "You will create havoc on earth twice, and display great haughtiness."

5.T.B.Irving: When the first of both warnings came, we dispatched servants of Ours to inflict severe violence upon you (all). They rampaged through [your] homes, and it served as a warning which was acted upon.

6.T.B.Irving: Then We offered you another chance against them, and reinforced you with wealth and children, and granted you more manpower.

7.T.B.Irving: If you have acted kindly, you acted kindly towards yourselves, while if you committed any evil, it was towards [yourselves] as well. Thus the warning about the next one came along to trouble your persons, and so they would enter the Mosque just as they had entered it in the first place, so they might utterly annihilate anything they overcame.

8.T.B.Irving: Perhaps your Lord may show mercy to you. If you should turn back, We will go back (too) and turn Hell into a confinement for disbelievers!

9.T.B.Irving: This Quran guides one to something that is more straightforward and reassures believers who perform honorable actions; they shall have great earnings.

10.T.B.Irving: Nevertheless We have reserved painful torment for those who do not believe in the Hereafter.

11.T.B.Irving: Man appeals for evil during his appeal for good; everyman has been so hasty!

12.T.B.Irving: We have granted night and daylight as twin signs. We blot out the sign of night, and grant the sign of daylight to see by so you may seek bounty from your Lord and know how to count the years and other such reckoning. Everything have We set forth in detail.

13.T.B.Irving: We have tied everyman´s fate around his neck; and We shall produce a book for him on Resurrection Day that he will find spread open;

14.T.B.Irving: "Read your book; today there will be none but yourself to call you to account!"

15.T.B.Irving: Anyone who submits to guidance will be guided only so far as he himself is concerned, while anyone who strays away, only strays by himself. No burdened soul shall bear another´s burden. We have never acted as punishers until We have dispatched some messenger:

16.T.B.Irving: yet whenever We want to wipe out some town, We order its high-livers so they act depraved in it; thus the Sentence about it is proven to be right and We utterly annihilate it.

17.T.B.Irving: How many generations did We destroy since Noah? Sufficient is it for your Lord to be Informed, Observant of His servants´ sins!

18.T.B.Irving: For anyone who wants the fleeting present, We let whatever We wish to flit past anyone We want it to. Then We set up Hell for him; he will roast in it, condemned, disgraced.

19.T.B.Irving: Anyone who wants the Hereafter and makes a proper effort to achieve it while he is a believer, will have their effort gratified.

20.T.B.Irving: Each We shall supply, these as well as those, with a gift from your Lord: your Lord´s gift will never be withheld.

21.T.B.Irving: Watch how We have permitted some of them to get ahead of others. The Hereafter will be greater in [conferring] ranks and even greater in attainment.

22.T.B.Irving: Do not place any other deity alongside God, lest you sit back, condemned, forsaken.

23.T.B.Irving: Your Lord has decreed that you should worship nothing except Him, and [show] kindness to your parents; whether either of them or both of them should attain old age [while they are] still with you, never say to them: "Naughty!" nor scold either of them. Speak to them in a generous fashion.

24.T.B.Irving: Protect them carefully from outsiders, and SAY: "My Lord, show them mercy, just as they cared for me [when I was] a little child!"

25.T.B.Irving: Your Lord is quite Aware of anything that is on your minds; if you behave honorably, then He will be Forgiving towards those who are attentive.

26.T.B.Irving: Render your close relative his due, as well as the pauper and the wayfarer. Yet do not squander [your money] extravagantly;

27.T.B.Irving: spendthrifts are the devils´ brethren, and Satan has always been ungrateful towards his Lord.

28.T.B.Irving: Yet if you have to avoid them, seeking some mercy which you may expect from your Lord, still speak a courteous word to them.

29.T.B.Irving: Do not keep your hand gripping at your throat nor stretch it out as far as it will reach, lest you sit back blameworthy, destitute.

30.T.B.Irving: Your Lord extends sustenance to anyone He wishes, and measures it out; He is Informed, Observant about His servants.

31.T.B.Irving: Do not kill your children in dread of poverty; We shall provide for both them and you. Killing them is a serious blunder!

32.T.B.Irving: Do not commit adultery. It is shocking and an evil way [to behave].

33.T.B.Irving: Do not kill any soul whom God has forbidden you to, except through [due process of] law. We have given his nearest relatives authority for anyone who is killed unjustly-yet let him not overdo things in killing [the culprit], inasmuch as he has been so supported.

34.T.B.Irving: Do not approach an orphan´s estate before he comes of age unless it is to improve it. Fulfill your oaths; any promise will be checked into.

35.T.B.Irving: Give full measure whenever you measure out anything, and weigh with honest scales; that is better and the finest way of acting.

36.T.B.Irving: Do not worry over something you have no knowledge about: your hearing, eyesight and vital organs will all be questioned concerning it.

37.T.B.Irving: Do not prance saucily around the earth; you can never tunnel through the earth nor rival the mountains in height.

38.T.B.Irving: All that is evil with your Lord, to be hated.

39.T.B.Irving: Such is some of the wisdom your Lord has revealed to you. Do not place any other deity alongside God [Alone] lest you be tossed into Hell, blamed, rejected.

40.T.B.Irving: Has your Lord singled you out to have sons, while He has accepted daughters from among the angels [for Himself]? You are uttering such a serious statement!

41.T.B.Irving: We have already spelled out matters in this Reading so they will notice it, even though it only adds to their disgust.

42.T.B.Irving: SAY: "If there were (other) gods along with Him as they say, then they would have sought a way to the Possessor of the Throne.

43.T.B.Irving: Glory be to Him! How greatly Exalted is He over anything they may say!

44.T.B.Irving: The Seven Heavens and Earth, as well as whoever is in them, glorify Him. Nothing exists unless it hymns His praise; yet you do not understand their glorification. Still He has been Lenient, Forgiving.

45.T.B.Irving: Whenever you read the Quran, We place a hidden curtain between you and those who do not believe in the Hereafter.

46.T.B.Irving: We place wrappers over their hearts lest they comprehend it, and dullness in their ears. When you mention your Lord Alone in the Quran they even turn their backs in disgust!

47.T.B.Irving: We are quite Aware as to what they are listening for when they listen to you, and whenever they conspire together, then wrongdoers will say: "You are only following a man who is bewitched!,"

48.T.B.Irving: Watch what sort of stories they make up about you. They have strayed away and are unable to find a way back.

49.T.B.Irving: They say: "When we are bones and mortal remains, will we be raised up in some fresh creation?"

50.T.B.Irving: SAY: "Become stones or iron

51.T.B.Irving: or any creation that seems important enough to fill your breasts;" so they will say: "Who will bring us back [to life]?" SAY: "The One Who originated you in the first place." They will wag their heads at you and say: "When will it be?" SAY: "Perhaps it is near!

52.T.B.Irving: Some day He will call on you, and you will respond in praise of Him. You will assume you have lingered for only a little while."

53.T.B.Irving: Tell My servants that they should say whatever is politest. Satan stirs up trouble among them; Satan is an open enemy to man!"

54.T.B.Irving: Your Lord is quite Aware of you (all); if He wishes, He will show you mercy, while if He wishes, He will punish you, We have not sent you as a trustee over them.

55.T.B.Irving: Your Lord is quite Aware of whoever is in Heaven and Earth. We have made some prophets excel over others, and given David the Psalms.

56.T.B.Irving: SAY: "Invoke those whom you claim to have besides Him: they do control any means of removing harm from you, nor for changing

57.T.B.Irving: Even those whom they appeal to, crave access to their Lord, vying to nearest. They hope for His mercy and fear His torment. Your Lo torment is something to beware of.´

58.T.B.Irving: No town exists but We shall act as its Destroyers before Resurrect Day, or as its Punishers by means of severe torment. That has recorded in the Book.

59.T.B.Irving: Nothing has prevented Us from sending except that early men rejected them. We sent Thamud the she-camel to open their eyes, yet they mistreated her. We merely send signs in order to frighten [people].

60.T.B.Irving: Thus We told you: "Your Lord embraces [all] kind." We granted the vision which We showed you only as a test for mankind, as well as the Tree that is cursed in the Quran. We let them feel afraid; yet it only increases great arrogance in them.

61.T.B.Irving: When We told the angels: "Bow down on your knees before Adam," they (all) knelt down except Diabolis. He said: "Am I to bow down on my knees before someone You have created out of clay?"

62.T.B.Irving: He said [further] : "Have You considered this person Yourself whom You have honored more than me? If You will postpone things for m Resurrection Day, then I shall bring all but a few of his offspring un mastery."

63.T.B.Irving: He said: "Go away! Any of them who follows you will have your reward; it is such an ample reward!

64.T.B.Irving: Entice any of them whom you can with your voice. Set upon them with your cavalry and your manpower. Share wealth and children with them, and promise them anything. (Yet Satan merely promises them illusion.)

65.T.B.Irving: As for My servants, you will have no authority over them; your Lord suffices as a Trustee."

66.T.B.Irving: Your Lord is the One Who propels ships for you at sea, so you may seek some of His bounty. He has been so Merciful towards you!

67.T.B.Irving: Whenever some adversity strikes you at sea, anyone you appeal to besides Him leaves [you] in the lurch; yet whenever We bring you safely to port, you (all) turn away evasively. Man has been so thankless!

68.T.B.Irving: Do you feel so safe that He will not let a slice of land cave in beneath you, or send a sandstorm down on you? Then you will find no agent to act on your behalf!

69.T.B.Irving: Or do you feel so secure that He will send you another chance at it, and drive a smashing gale against you which will drown you because you have disbelieved? Then you will not find any follower in it to [help] you against Us.

70.T.B.Irving: We have dignified the Children of Adam and transported them around on land and at sea. we have provided them with wholesome things and favored them especially over many of those whom We have created.

71.T.B.Irving: Some day We shall call forth all mankind along with whoever has led them, Those who are given their book in their right hand, will read their book and not be harmed one bit;

72.T.B.Irving: while anyone who has been blind in this [life] will remain blind in the Hereafter, and go even further astray .

73.T.B.Irving: They almost lure you away from what We have revealed to you, in order to invent something else against Us; then they would adopt you as a bosom friend!

74.T.B.Irving: If we had not braced you, you might have almost inclined a little bit towards them.

75.T.B.Irving: Then We would have made you taste a double share of life and a double one of dying; then you would not have found any supporter for yourself against Us!

76.T.B.Irving: They almost scare you off the earth, to exile you from it. Yet they would never survive you except for a short while.

77.T.B.Irving: [Such has been] the practice with any of Our messengers whom We have sent before you. You will never find any chance in Our course!

78.T.B.Irving: Keep up prayer from the decline of the sun, until twilight a night; and [observe] the Reading at daybreak, since reading [the Quran] at daybreak will be witnessed!

79.T.B.Irving: At night, wake up and pray during it[s reading] as an extra bonus for yourself; perhaps your Lord will raise you once again to a praiseworthy standing.

80.T.B.Irving: SAY: "My Lord, let me enter through a proper entrance and leave by an honest exit! Grant me supporting authority from Your presence."

81.T.B.Irving: And SAY (too): "Truth has come and falsehood vanished; falsehood is so perishable!

82.T.B.Irving: We send down something from the Quran [to serve] as healing and a mercy for believers, while wrongdoers are only increased in loss.

83.T.B.Irving: Whenever We show man some favor, he avoids it and drifts off to one side; while whenever evil touches him, he acts desperate.

84.T.B.Irving: SAY: Everyone acts according to his own disposition. Your Lord is quite Aware as to who is best guided along the Way."

85.T.B.Irving: They will ask you about the Spirit. SAY: "The Spirit [operates] at my Lord´s command, while you have been given only a smattering of knowledge."

86.T.B.Irving: If We so wished, We would take away anything We have inspired you with; then you would not find anyone you could rely on against Us with it

87.T.B.Irving: except for some mercy from your Lord, His bounty towards you has been great!

88.T.B.Irving: SAY: "Even if men and sprites organized to produce something like this Reading, they would never bring anything like it no matter how much assistance they lent one another."

89.T.B.Irving: We have set forth every [kind of] parable for mankind in this Reading; yet most men refuse to do anything except disbelieve.

90.T.B.Irving: They say: "We will never believe in you unless you cause a spring to gush forth from the earth for us,

91.T.B.Irving: or have a garden full of datepalms and grapevines and make rivers gush forth plentifully through the midst of them,

92.T.B.Irving: or you cause the sky to fall in pieces on us just as you claim, bring God and His angels to vouch for you,

93.T.B.Irving: or you have a luxurious house built, or soar up into the sky; we will never believe in your climbing up there until you bring down a book for us to read." SAY: ´Glory be to my Lord! Am I anything but a human messenger?"

94.T.B.Irving: Nothing prevents men from believing whenever guidance comes to them except that they say: "Has God dispatched a mortal as a messenger?"

95.T.B.Irving: SAY: "If there had been angels calmly walking around on earth, we would have sent an angel down from Heaven as a messenger for them."

96.T.B.Irving: SAY: "God suffices as a Witness between me and you (all). He is Informed, Observant about His servants."

97.T.B.Irving: Anyone whom God guides, remains guided, while you will never find any sponsors besides Himself for those He lets go astray. We will summon them face down on Resurrection Day, blind, dumb and deaf; their lodging will be Hell. Every time it dies down, We will make it blaze up again for them.

98.T.B.Irving: Such will be their reward for disbelieving in Our signs and saying: "Once we are bones and mortal remains, will we be raised up again in some fresh creation?"

99.T.B.Irving: Do they not consider that God, Who has created Heaven and Earth, is Able to create the like of them? He has set them a deadline there is no doubt about, yet wrongdoers refuse to do anything except disbelieve.

100.T.B.Irving: SAY: "Even if you controlled the treasures of my Lord´s mercy, you would still hold them back in dread of overspending [them]. Man is so grudging!"

101.T.B.Irving: We gave Moses nine clear signs. Ask the Children of Israel about how, when he came to them and Pharaoh told him: "I think you are out of your mind, Moses!",

102.T.B.Irving: he said: "You know that no one except them Lord of Heaven and Earth has sent these down as insights. I think you are doomed, Pharaoh!"

103.T.B.Irving: He wanted to scare them away from the land, so We drowned him and everyone who accompanied him.

104.T.B.Irving: Later on, We told the Children of Israel: ´Settle down in the land. When the promise about the Hereafter comes along, We will bring you in as a rabble."

105.T.B.Irving: We have really sent it down, and it has come down for the Truth. We have sent you only as a newsbearer and warner;

106.T.B.Irving: and for a Reading which We have divided up so you can read it to people in sittings. We have sent it down as a successive revelation.

107.T.B.Irving: SAY: "Believe in it, or do not believe in it;" those who have already been given knowledge fall down bowing with their faces [on the ground]whenever it is recited to them,

108.T.B.Irving: while they say: "Glory to our Lord! Our Lord´s promise has come true!

109.T.B.Irving: They fall down with their faces [on the ground], weeping and it increases them in reverence.

110.T.B.Irving: SAY: Appeal to God, or appeal to the Mercy-giving: whichever [name] you may invoke, He still has the Finest Names. Do not shout in your prayer nor say it under your breath; seek a course in between."

111.T.B.Irving: SAY: "Praise be to God Who has adopted no son and has no partner in control." He needs no protector against pettiness. Magnify Him greatly!

1.T.B.Irving: Praise be to God, Who has sent down the Book for His servants and has placed no distortion in it;

2.T.B.Irving: [it is] straightforward, so He may warn about serious violence from Himself and give good news to believers who perform honorable deeds. they will have a handsome wage,

3.T.B.Irving: to bask in it for ever and ever.

4.T.B.Irving: He warns those who say: "God has adopted a son."

5.T.B.Irving: They have no knowledge about it, nor did their forefathers have any either. It is too serious a statement to come out of their mouths: they are merely telling a lie!

6.T.B.Irving: Perhaps you will fret yourself to death checking up on them, worrying lest they will not believe this report.

7.T.B.Irving: We have placed whatever is on earth as an ornament for it so We may test them as to which one is best in action;

8.T.B.Irving: and We shall turn anything on it into a barren wasteland.

9.T.B.Irving: Have you considered how the Companions in the Cave and with the Tablet were such marvelous signs of Ours?

10.T.B.Irving: Thus the youths sought shelter in the Cave, and said: "Our Lord, grant us mercy from Your presence and furnish us with some direction in our affair."

11.T.B.Irving: We struck them with drowsiness in the Cave for several years;

12.T.B.Irving: then We awakened them again so We might know which of the two parties would best calculate how long a stretch they had remained [there].

13.T.B.Irving: We shall relate their story to you correctly: They were young men who believed in their Lord, and We gave them extra guidance.

14.T.B.Irving: We strengthened their hearts when they stood up and said: "Our Lord is Lord of Heaven and Earth. We will never appeal to any deity except Him; should we say [such a thing], then it would be an outrage.

15.T.B.Irving: These people of ours have adopted other gods besides Him. If they would only bring some clear authority to support them!" Who is more in the wrong than someone who invents a lie about God?

16.T.B.Irving: When you withdraw from them and whatever they serve instead of God, then seek shelter in the Cave. Your Lord will spread some of His mercy over you and make fitting arrangements for you in your affair.

17.T.B.Irving: You should have seen how the sun as it rose, swerved away from their Cave toward the right; and as it set, slanted off toward the left of them, while they lay in a space in between. That was one of God´s signs. Anyone whom God guides, remains guided; while anyone He lets go astray will never find any patron to set him straight.

18.T.B.Irving: You would reckon they were awake, while they [really] lay there asleep. We turned them over on the right and on the left, while their dog lay stretched out with his forepaws over the threshold. If you had chanced upon them, you would have turned and fled from them; you would have been filled with awe of them!

19.T.B.Irving: Even so We raised them up again so they might question one another. One of them spoke up and said: "How long have you stayed [here]?" They said: "We have stayed a day, or part of a day." They said: "Your Lord is quite Aware of how long you have stayed [here], so send one of your men to the city with this coin of yours. Let him see which food is the most suitable and bring you [back] a supply of it. Let him act discreetly and not make anyone aware of you.

20.T.B.Irving: If they should find out about you, they will stone you or make you turn back to their sect. You would never succeed then!"

21.T.B.Irving: Thus We disclosed things to them so they might know that God´s promise has come true and there is no doubt about the Hour. So [people] debated their case among themselves, and they said: "Build a monument over them. Their Lord is quite Aware of them." Those who won out in the end said: "Let us erect a shrine for them,"

22.T.B.Irving: They will say: "[They were] three, the fourth of them being their dog;" while [others] will say: "Five, the sixth of them is their dog," guessing at the Unseen. [Still others] say: "Seven, and the eighth of them is their dog." SAY: "My Lord is quite Aware as to how many they were. Only a few know about them." Do not discuss them except in a discussion that is obvious, nor seek anyone else´s opinion about them.

23.T.B.Irving: (Do not say about anything: "I am doing that tomorrow,"

24.T.B.Irving: unless [you add]: "Should God so wish!" Remember your Lord whenever you might forget, and SAY: ´Perhaps my Lord will guide me even closer than this to proper behavior.")

25.T.B.Irving: And they stayed in their Cave for three hundred years plus nine more.

26.T.B.Irving: SAY: "God is quite Aware as to how long they stayed [there]. He holds the Unseen in Heaven and Earth; He is quite Observant of it, quite Alert as well. They have no patron besides Him, nor does He let anyone else share in His discretion."

27.T.B.Irving: Quote whatever has been revealed to you from your Lord´s book: there is no one who may change His words, nor will you ever find any sanctuary except in Him.

28.T.B.Irving: Restrain yourself concerning those who appeal to their Lord in the morning and evening, wanting His presence; yet do not let your eyes wander too far from them, desiring the attraction of worldly life. Do not obey anyone whose heart We allow to neglect remembering Us, so he pursues his own whim. His case results in dissipation.

29.T.B.Irving: SAY: "Truth comes from your Lord. Let anyone who wishes to, believe, and anyone who wishes to, disbelieve." We have reserved a fire for wrongdoers whose sheets will hem them in. If they should ask for some relief, then water like molten brass will be showered on them to scorch their faces. How awful such a drink will and how evil is such a couch!

30.T.B.Irving: As for those who believe and perform honorable deeds, well We shall not waste the earnings of anyone whose action has been kind.

31.T.B.Irving: Those shall have the gardens of Eden through which rivers will flow. They will be decked out with gold bracelets the and wear green silk clothing and brocade, as they lean back on sofas in it. How superb will such a recompense be and how handsome is the couch!

32.T.B.Irving: Set forth a comparison between two men for them: We granted two vineyards to one of them, and bordered them with datepalms and planted field crops in between.

33.T.B.Irving: Each garden produced its food and did not fail to yield its best; We even caused a river to spring forth in the midst of them.

34.T.B.Irving: One man had fruit and told his companion while he was discussing things with him: "I am wealthier than you are, and have a bigger following!"

35.T.B.Irving: He entered his garden while he was thus harming his own soul. He said: "I do not think that this will ever disappear!

36.T.B.Irving: I do not think the Hour is at hand; if I am ever sent back to my Lord, I shall find something better than it in exchange."

37.T.B.Irving: His companion told him while he was discussing things with him: "Have you disbelieved in the One Who created you from dust, then from a drop of semen; then fashioned you into a man?

38.T.B.Irving: However so far as we are concerned, He is God my Lord, and I do not associate anyone with my Lord!

39.T.B.Irving: Why, as you entered your garden, did you not say: "Whatever God may wish; there is no strength except through God [Alone]? Even if you see how I am less wealthy than you are and have fewer children,

40.T.B.Irving: perhaps my Lord will still give me something better than your garden and send a reckoning down from Heaven on it, so it will eventually become a bald hilltop,

41.T.B.Irving: or its water will sink down some morning and you will never manage to find it again."

42.T.B.Irving: He was caught short with his fruit, and one morning he began to wring his hands over what he had spent on it, since it had tumbled down from its trellises. He kept saying: "It´s too bad for me; I should never have associated anyone with my Lord!"

43.T.B.Irving: He had no party to support him against God, so he was not supported.

44.T.B.Irving: That is how patronage lies with the True God. He is Best as a recompense and Best in results.

45.T.B.Irving: Set forth an example for them about worldly life being like water We send down from the sky, The plants on the earth swell up with it; yet some morning they will become dry weeds which the winds will blow away. God is Competent to do everything!

46.T.B.Irving: Wealth and children are an attraction during worldly life. Yet honorable deeds that last forever are better as a recompense from your Lord and even better to hope for.

47.T.B.Irving: Some day We shall set the mountains travelling along and you will see the earth lying exposed. We will summon them and not one of them shall We omit;

48.T.B.Irving: They will be marshaled in ranks before your Lord: "You have come to Us just as We created you in the first place even though you claimed We would never make any appointment for you."

49.T.B.Irving: The Book will be produced and you will see criminals apprehensive about its contents. They will say: "It´s too late for us! What does this book mean for me? It omits nothing either small nor large unless it is accounted for." They will find whatever they have done presented there, even though your Lord will not harm anyone.

50.T.B.Irving: When We told the angels: "Bow down on your knees before Adam," they [all] knelt down except for Diabolis; he was a sprite and acted contrary to his Lord´s command. Will you (all) adopt him and his offspring as patrons instead of Myself? They are enemies of yours! How wretched is such an alternative for wrongdoers.

51.T.B.Irving: I did not have them as witnesses at the creation of Heaven and Earth, nor even at their own creation. I am not about to adopt those who lead [others] astray as [My] attendants.

52.T.B.Irving: Some day He will say: "Call on My associates whom you claim to have, and appeal to them." They will not respond to them, while We shall place a chasm between them.

53.T.B.Irving: Criminals will see the Fire and think they are falling into it. They will not find any way to avert it.

54.T.B.Irving: We have spelled out every sort of example for mankind in this Quran yet everyman uses it just for argument in most cases.

55.T.B.Irving: What has prevented men from believing and seeking forgiveness from their Lord, once guidance has come to them, except [they may wish] that the practice of primitive people should come along with them, or that torment come face to face with them.

56.T.B.Irving: We have sent emissaries merely as heralds and warners while those who disbelieve idly argue away so they may refute the Truth by means of it. They treat My signs and what they are warned of as a joke!

57.T.B.Irving: Who is more in the wrong than someone who has been reminded about his Lord´s signs and then avoids them, and forgets anything his hands may have sent on ahead? We have placed wrappings over their hearts and dullness in their ears lest they understand it. Even if you called them to guidance, they still would never consent to be guided.

58.T.B.Irving: Your Lord is the Forgiving, the Possessor of Mercy. If He were to take them to task for what they have earned, He would hasten torment for them; instead they have their appointment from which they will never find any asylum.

59.T.B.Irving: Such towns have We destroyed whenever they did wrong, and We fixed the time for their destruction.

60.T.B.Irving: And so Moses told his young man: "I shall not give up until I reach the place where both seas meet, even though I spend ages doing so."

61.T.B.Irving: So when they reached the place where they had met, they forgot their fish, which took its way to the sea as if it went out through a drain.

62.T.B.Irving: When they had gone still further, he told his young man: ´Bring us our lunch; we have experienced so much strain along our journey."

63.T.B.Irving: He said: "Did you see when we were resting by the rock, that I forgot the fish? Unless it was Satan who made me forget it so I did not remember it. It took its way through the sea like something marvelous!"

64.T.B.Irving: He said: "That is just what we´ve been searching for." So they retraced their steps the way they had come.

65.T.B.Irving: They found one of Our servants to whom We had given mercy from Ourself and taught him knowledge from Our very presence.

66.T.B.Irving: Moses said to him: "May I follow you so you may teach me some of the common sense you have been taught?"

67.T.B.Irving: He said: "You will never have any patience with me!

68.T.B.Irving: How can you show any patience with something that is beyond your experience?"

69.T.B.Irving: He said: "You will find me patient, if God so wishes, I will not disobey you in any matter."

70.T.B.Irving: He said: "If you follow me, do not ask me about anything until I tell you something to remember it by."

71.T.B.Irving: So they both started out until, as they boarded the ship, he bored a hole in her. He said: "Have you scuttled her to drown her crew? You have done such a weird thing!"

72.T.B.Irving: He said: "Didn´t I say that you would not manage to show any patience with me?"

73.T.B.Irving: He said: "Do not take me to task for what I have forgotten, nor weigh me down by making my case too difficult for me."

74.T.B.Irving: They journeyed on until when they met a youth, he killed him. He said: "Have you killed an innocent soul without any previous murder [on his part]? You have committed such a horrible deed!"

75.T.B.Irving: He said: "Did I not tell you that you would never manage to have any patience with me?"

76.T.B.Irving: He said: "If I ever ask you about anything after this, do not let me accompany you. You have found an excuse so far as I am concerned."

77.T.B.Irving: They both proceeded further till when they came to the people of a [certain] town, they asked its inhabitants for some food, and they refused to treat either of them hospitably. They found a wall there which was about to tumble down, so he set it straight. He said: "If you had wished, you might have accepted some payment for it."

78.T.B.Irving: He said: "This [means] a parting between you and me. Yet I shall inform you about the interpretation of what you had no patience for.

79.T.B.Irving: "As for the ship, it belonged to some poor men who worked at sea. I wanted to damage it because there was a king behind them seizing every ship by force.

80.T.B.Irving: The young man´s parents were believers, and we dreaded lest he would burden them with arrogation and disbelief.

81.T.B.Irving: We wanted their Lord to replace him for them with someone better than him in purity and nearer to tenderness.

82.T.B.Irving: "The well belonged to two orphan boys [living] in the city, and a treasure of theirs lay underneath it. Their father had been honorable, so your Lord wanted them to come of age and claim their treasure as a mercy from your Lord. I did not do it of my own accord. That is the interpretation of what you showed no patience for."

83.T.B.Irving: They will ask you about Double Horns. SAY: "I shall render an account of him for you."

84.T.B.Irving: We established things on earth for him, and gave him access to everything;

85.T.B.Irving: so he followed a [certain] course

86.T.B.Irving: until when he reached the place where the sun sets, he found it setting in a mucky spring alongside which he (also) found some people. We said: "Double Horn either you will punish [them] or else act kindly towards them."

87.T.B.Irving: He said: "Anyone who has done wrong we shall punish; then he will be sent back to his Lord, and He will punish him with horrible torment.

88.T.B.Irving: Anyone who believes and acts honorably will have the finest reward and we will tell him gently about our command."

89.T.B.Irving: Then he followed [another] course

90.T.B.Irving: until when he reached the place where the sun rises, he found it rising on a folk whom We had not granted any protection against it.

91.T.B.Irving: That was how We controlled information about whatever lay before him.

92.T.B.Irving: Then he followed [still another] course

93.T.B.Irving: until when he reached two barriers, he found a folk on the nearer side of them who scarcely understood any speech.

94.T.B.Irving: They said: "Double Horns, Gog and Magog are ravaging the earth. Shall we pay you tribute on condition that you place a barrier between us and them?"

95.T.B.Irving: He said: "Whatever my Lord has empowered me to do is even better, so help me with some [man] power: I´ll place a rampart between you and them.

96.T.B.Irving: Bring me blocks of iron. When he had leveled off [the space] between both cliffs, he said: "Blow on it!", until when he had built it up into a fire, he said: "Bring me molten brass so I may pour some over it."

97.T.B.Irving: They neither managed to climb over nor were they able to tunnel through it.

98.T.B.Irving: He said: "This is a mercy from my Lord. Whenever my Lord´s promise comes, he will make it crumble. My Lord´s promise is true!"

99.T.B.Irving: We will leave some of them surging over others on that day. The Trumpet shall be blown, and We will gather them all together.

100.T.B.Irving: On that day We will spread Hell out on display for disbelievers

101.T.B.Irving: whose eyes have been under blinders against [seeing] My reminder. They have not even managed to hear!

102.T.B.Irving: Do those who disbelieve reckon they will adopt My servants as patrons instead of Me? We have reserved Hell as a lodging for disbelievers!

103.T.B.Irving: SAY: "Shall We announce to you those who have lost the most through [their] actions?"

104.T.B.Irving: Those whose effort led them astray during worldly life, while they reckoned they were producing something fine,

105.T.B.Irving: are the ones who have disbelieved in their Lord´s signs and about meeting Him; their actions will prove to be useless, and We shall set up no weighing-in for them on Resurrection Day.

106.T.B.Irving: Such will be their reward - Hell, because of how they have disbelieved and taken My signs and My messengers for a laughingstock.

107.T.B.Irving: Those who believe and perform honorable deeds will have the gardens of Paradise as a lodging

108.T.B.Irving: to live in forever; they will never seek any transfer from it.

109.T.B.Irving: SAY: "If the sea were an inkwell for the words of my Lord, the sea would be drained before my Lord´s words would be spent even though we brought the same again to replenish it.

110.T.B.Irving: SAY: "I am only a human being like yourselves; it has been revealed to me that your deity is God Alone. Anyone who is expecting to meet his Lord should act honorably and not associate anyone in the worship due his Lord."

1.T.B.Irving: K.H.Y.E.S.

2.T.B.Irving: [This is] a Reminder of your Lord´s mercy towards his servant Zachariah

3.T.B.Irving: when he appealed to his Lord with a suppressed cry.

4.T.B.Irving: He said: "My Lord, my bones are tottering for me and my head is glistening with white hair, while I have never been grumbling in my appeal to You, my Lord!

5.T.B.Irving: Yet I fear for my heirs after me from Your presence

6.T.B.Irving: who may inherit from me, and inherit from Jacob´s house. Make him someone we can approve of, my Lord!"

7.T.B.Irving: "Zachariah, We bring you news about a boy whose name will be John. We have not given such a name to anyone before."

8.T.B.Irving: He said: "My Lord, how will I have a boy while my wife is barren and I have reached such extreme old age?"

9.T.B.Irving: He said: "Just as your Lord has said: ´It is a trifling thing for me [to do]. I created you before while you were still nothing!"´

10.T.B.Irving: He said: "My Lord, grant me a sign!" He said: "Your sign will be that you will not speak to any people for three nights in a row."

11.T.B.Irving: He came forth to his folk from the sanctuary and revealed to them how they should glorify [God] both morning and evening.

12.T.B.Irving: "John, hold firmly to the Book." We gave him discretion as a young boy

13.T.B.Irving: plus compassion from Our presence and innocence. He was conscientious

14.T.B.Irving: and considerate towards his parents, and was not demanding, rebellious.

15.T.B.Irving: Peace be upon him the day he was born, and the day he will die, and the day he is raised to life again!

16.T.B.Irving: Mention in the Book how Mary withdrew from her people to an Eastem place.

17.T.B.Irving: She chose to be secluded from them. We sent her Our spirit, who presented himself to her as a full-grown human being.

18.T.B.Irving: She said: "I take refuge with the Mercy-giving from you, unless you are someone who does his duty."

19.T.B.Irving: He said: ´I am only your Lord´s messenger to bestow a clean-living boy on you,"

20.T.B.Irving: She said: "How shall I have a boy when no human being has ever touched me, nor am I a loose woman?"

21.T.B.Irving: He said: "Thus your Lord has said: "It is a simple matter for Me [to do]. We will grant him as a sign for mankind and a mercy from Ourself." It is a matter that has been decided."

22.T.B.Irving: So she conceived him, and withdrew to a remote place to have him.

23.T.B.Irving: Labor pains came over her by the trunk of a datepalm. She said: "If only I had died before this, and been forgotten, overlooked!"

24.T.B.Irving: Someone called out to her from below where she was: "Don´t feel so sad! Your Lord has placed a brook at your feet.

25.T.B.Irving: Shake the trunk of the datepalm towards you so it will drop some fresh dates on you.

26.T.B.Irving: Eat and drink, and refresh yourself. Should you see even a single human being, then say: "I have vowed to keep a fast to the Mercy-giving whereby I´ll never speak to any person today!"´

27.T.B.Irving: She carried him back to her family. They said: "Mary, you have brought something hard to believe!

28.T.B.Irving: Kinswoman of Aaron, your father was no evil man, nor was your mother a loose woman."

29.T.B.Irving: She pointed to him. They said: "How shall we talk to someone who is a child in the cradle?"

30.T.B.Irving: He said: "I am God´s servant. He has given me the Book and made me a prophet.

31.T.B.Irving: He has made me blessed wherever I may be, and commissioned me to pray and [pay] the welfare tax so long as I live;

32.T.B.Irving: and [to act] considerate towards my mother. He has not made me domineering, hard to get along with.

33.T.B.Irving: Peace be on the day I was born, and the day I shall die and the day I am raised to life again!"

34.T.B.Irving: Such was Jesus, the son of Mary; [it is] a true statement which they are still puzzling over.

35.T.B.Irving: It is not God´s role to adopt a son. Glory be to Him! Whenever He determines upon some matter, He merely tells it: "Be!", and it is.

36.T.B.Irving: God is my Lord and your Lord, so worship Him [Alone]. This is a Straight Road [to follow].

37.T.B.Irving: Factions have differed among themselves, yet how awful will it be for those who disbelieve when it comes to the spectacle on such a dreadful day!

38.T.B.Irving: Listen to them and watch for the day when they will come to Us; though wrongdoers are in obvious error even today.

39.T.B.Irving: Warn them of the Day of Regret when the matter will be decided; they act so heedless and still do not believe.

40.T.B.Irving: It is We Who will inherit the earth plus anyone on it; to Us shall they return!

41.T.B.Irving: Mention Abraham in the Book. He was a truthful prophet

42.T.B.Irving: when he told his father: "My father, why do you worship something that neither hears nor perceives [anything], and does not benefit you in anyway"?

43.T.B.Irving: My father, I have been given some knowledge which has not come to you, so follow me: I´ll guide you along a Level Road.

44.T.B.Irving: My father, do not serve Satan! Satan was defiant towards the Mercygiving.

45.T.B.Irving: My father, I fear lest some torment from the Mercy-giving should afflict you, and you become a partisan of Satan."

46.T.B.Irving: He said: "Do you dislike my gods, Abraham? If you do not stop, I´ll cast you out. Leave me alone as soon as you can!"

47.T.B.Irving: He said: "Peace be upon you! I´ll seek forgiveness for you from my Lord; He has been so Gracious towards me.

48.T.B.Irving: I´ll move away from you (all) and from anything you appeal to instead of God. I shall appeal to my Lord; perhaps I´ll not feel quite so miserable with my Lord´s appeal."

49.T.B.Irving: When he moved away from them and what they worshipped instead of God, We bestowed Isaac and Jacob on him. Each We made a prophet.

50.T.B.Irving: We bestowed some of Our mercy on them and granted them a sublime tongue for telling truth.

51.T.B.Irving: Mention Moses in the Book. He was sincere, and was a messenger, a prophet.

52.T.B.Irving: We called out to him from the right side of the Mountain, and brought him close to confide in.

53.T.B.Irving: We bestowed his brother Aaron on him as a prophet through Our mercy.

54.T.B.Irving: Mention Ishmael in the Book. He kept true to the Promise, and was a messenger, a prophet.

55.T.B.Irving: He used to order his people to pray and [pay] the welfare tax; he was approved by his Lord.

56.T.B.Irving: Mention Idifs in the Book. He was a truthful prophet;

57.T.B.Irving: We raised him to a lofty place.

58.T.B.Irving: Those are some of the prophets from Adam´s offspring whom God has favored, and some of those We transported along with Noah, and some of Abraham´s and Ishmael´s offspring, as well as some (others) We have guided and chosen. Whenever the Mercy-giving´s signs are recited to them, they drop down on their knees and weep!

59.T.B.Irving: Descendants have replaced them who neglected prayer and followed [their own] passions. They shall meet with aimlessness

60.T.B.Irving: except for anyone who turns around (in repentance) and believes, and acts honorably; those will enter the Garden and not be harmed in any way-

61.T.B.Irving: -the gardens of Eden which the Mercy-giving has promised His servants even though [they are still] Unseen. So far as He is concerned, His promise has already been fulfilled.

62.T.B.Irving: They will hear no nonsense in it, only: "Peace!" (as a greeting); they will have their provision there both morning and evening.

63.T.B.Irving: Such is the Garden which We bequeath to those of Our servants who have been pious.

64.T.B.Irving: We never descend except at your Lord´s command. He owns whatever is in front of us and whatever is behind us, and whatever lies in between. Your Lord is not forgetful,

65.T.B.Irving: [for He is] the Lord of Heaven and Earth and whatever lies in between them! So serve Him and persevere in His worship. Do you know of any other title for Him?"

66.T.B.Irving: Everyman says: "When I die will I be brought forth alive [again]?"

67.T.B.Irving: Does man not recall that We already created him once when he was nothing?

68.T.B.Irving: By your Lord, We shall summon both them and the devils; then We shall parade them forth to crouch around Hell!

69.T.B.Irving: Next We shall drag those away from every sect who have been the most insolent towards the Mercy-giving.

70.T.B.Irving: Thus We are quite Aware as to who are the closest to roasting in it;

71.T.B.Irving: there is not one of you but he will be led up to it. That is a decree determined by your Lord.

72.T.B.Irving: Then We shall save those who have heeded and leave the wrongdoers crouching inside.

73.T.B.Irving: Whenever Our clear signs are recited to them, those who disbelieve say to those who believe: ´Which group is better in status and a finer club to join?"

74.T.B.Irving: How many generations have We wiped out before them who were even finer in equipment and appearance!

75.T.B.Irving: SAY: "May the Mercy-giving extend an opportunity to anyone who has been in error so that when they see what they are threatened with, whether it is torment or even the Hour, they will know who is in a worse plight and has the weakest following.

76.T.B.Irving: God increases guidance for those who have consented to be guided while honorable deeds that endure are best with your Lord as recompense and yield the best returns.

77.T.B.Irving: Have you seen someone who disowns Our signs and says: "I shall still be given wealth and children?

78.T.B.Irving: Has he probed the Unseen or made a pled with the Mercy-giving?

79.T.B.Irving: Not at all! We shall write down anything he says and extend a chance of torment to him;

80.T.B.Irving: We will inherit anything he says, and he will come to Us as an individual.

81.T.B.Irving: They have adopted other deities instead of God, so they will mean [more] influence for them.

82.T.B.Irving: Not at all! The [false gods] will reject their own worship and pit themselves against them.

83.T.B.Irving: Have you not seen how We send devils to disbelievers, to provoke them to fury?

84.T.B.Irving: So do not act hasty towards them; We are only counting out so much [time] for them.

85.T.B.Irving: Some day We shall summon the heedful in a delegation before the Mercy-giving,

86.T.B.Irving: and drive criminals in a drove towards Hell.

87.T.B.Irving: They will possess no power of intercession except for someone who has already accepted a pledge from the Mercy-giving.

88.T.B.Irving: They say: "The Mercy-giving has adopted a son!"

89.T.B.Irving: You have brought up something monstrous!

90.T.B.Irving: "Me heavens almost burst apart from it, while the earth splits open and the mountains fall down with a crash

91.T.B.Irving: that anyone should ascribe a son to the Mercy-giving!

92.T.B.Irving: It is not proper for the Mercy-giving to adopt a son.

93.T.B.Irving: Everyone who is in Heaven and Earth comes to the Mercy-giving merely as a servant;

94.T.B.Irving: He numbers them and counts them up.

95.T.B.Irving: Each of them is coming to Him on Resurrection Day as an individual.

96.T.B.Irving: The Mercy-giving will grant affection to those who believe and perform honorable deeds.

97.T.B.Irving: We have made it easy for your tongue so you may announce good news about it to those who do their duty, and warn headstrong folk by means of it.

98.T.B.Irving: How many generations have We wiped out before them? Do you find any trace of even one of them, or hear a murmur from them?

1.T.B.Irving: T. H.

2.T.B.Irving: We have not sent the Quran down to you in order to upset you,

3.T.B.Irving: but only as a Reminder for someone who acts cautiously;

4.T.B.Irving: [it is] a revelation from the One Who created the earth and the highest heavens,

5.T.B.Irving: the Mercy-giving [Who is] settled on the Throne.

6.T.B.Irving: He owns whatever is in Heaven and whatever is on Earth, as well as whatever lies in between them, and what lies underneath the sod.

7.T.B.Irving: No matter whether you speak out loud, He still knows your secrets and what is even more suppressed.

8.T.B.Irving: God, there is no deity except Him! His are the Finest Names!

9.T.B.Irving: Has Moses´ story ever reached you?

10.T.B.Irving: Once he saw a fire and told his family: "Wait here; I have glimpsed a fire. Maybe I can bring you a coal from it, or find some guidance at the fire."

11.T.B.Irving: As he came up to it, [a voice] called out: "Moses,

12.T.B.Irving: I am your Lord! Take off your sandals; you are in the sacred valley of Tuwa.

13.T.B.Irving: I have chosen you, so listen to whatever is revealed:

14.T.B.Irving: I am God [Alone]! There is no deity except Myself, so serve Me and keep up prayer to remember Me by.

15.T.B.Irving: The Hour is coming! I am keeping it hidden so that each soul may be rewarded for whatever it accomplishes.

16.T.B.Irving: So do not let anyone who does not believe in it and follows his own passion, bar you from it so that you may perish!

17.T.B.Irving: "What do you have in your right hand, Moses?"

18.T.B.Irving: He said: "It is my staff. I lean on it, and beat down fodder for my sheep and goats with it; and I have still other uses for it."

19.T.B.Irving: He said: "Toss it down, Moses."

20.T.B.Irving: So he threw it down, and just imagine, it became a snake that crawled along!

21.T.B.Irving: He said: "Pick it up, and do not be afraid. We shall return it to its original shape.

22.T.B.Irving: And stick your hand under your armpit: it will come out white without [showing] any blemish, as another sign

23.T.B.Irving: so that We may show you some of Our greatest signs!

24.T.B.Irving: Go to Pharaoh; he has been so arrogant."

25.T.B.Irving: He said: "My Lord, ease my breast for me!

26.T.B.Irving: Make my affair easier for me,

27.T.B.Irving: and loose a knot from my tongue

28.T.B.Irving: so they may understand whatever I say.

29.T.B.Irving: Grant me a helpmate from my own people,

30.T.B.Irving: Aaron, my brother.

31.T.B.Irving: Back me up by means of him "

32.T.B.Irving: and let him share in my affair

33.T.B.Irving: so that we may glorify You frequently

34.T.B.Irving: and mention You often,

35.T.B.Irving: since You have been Observant of us."

36.T.B.Irving: He said: "You have been granted your request, Moses.

37.T.B.Irving: We endowed you another time

38.T.B.Irving: when We revealed whatever was revealed to your mother:

39.T.B.Irving: "Cast him into the chest, and toss it into the river. The current will throw him up on the shore where an enemy of Mine as well as an enemy of his will pick him up." "I have lavished love of My own on you so that you might be made into My darling.

40.T.B.Irving: So your sister was walking along, and said: Shall I lead you to someone who will take care of him?´ Thus We returned you to your mother to comfort her and so she would not feel so sad." "You killed a soul and We saved you from grief. We tested you severely, and you stayed among the people of Midian for years. Then you came just as fate [decreed], Moses.

41.T.B.Irving: I have produced you for Myself.

42.T.B.Irving: Take My signs away, both you and your brother, and do not neglect to mention Me.

43.T.B.Irving: Go to Pharaoh; he has been so arrogant.

44.T.B.Irving: Speak a soft word to him so that he may be reminded or even feel afraid."

45.T.B.Irving: They both said: "Our Lord, we fear lest he crack down on us or that he should act arrogant."

46.T.B.Irving: He said: "Do not fear; I am with you both. I both hear and see.

47.T.B.Irving: Go to him and say: "We are both messengers from your Lord. Send the Children of Israel away with us and do not torment them. We have brought you a sign from your Lord, and may "Peace be upon whoever follows guidance."

48.T.B.Irving: As for us, it has been revealed to us that torment is due anyone who says it is a lie and turns away!´"

49.T.B.Irving: He said; "Who is Lord for both of you, Moses?"

50.T.B.Irving: He said: "Our Lord is the One Who has given everything its own constitution; then guided it."

51.T.B.Irving: He said: "So what was the attitude during earlier centuries?"

52.T.B.Irving: He said: "Knowledge concerning them rests in a Book with my Lord. My Lord neither misses anything, nor does He forget,

53.T.B.Irving: [since he is the One] Who has laid out the earth as a carpet for you and has traced highways on it for you, and sent down water from the sky, We have brought forth every sort of plant with it, of various types.

54.T.B.Irving: Eat and pasture your livestock [on it]; in that are signs for men of accomplishment.

55.T.B.Irving: "From it We have created you and We will return you to it, and from it shall We bring you forth for another chance."

56.T.B.Irving: Yet We showed him all Our signs, and he said they were ties and rejected them!

57.T.B.Irving: He said: "Have you come to us to turn us out of our land through your magic, Moses?

58.T.B.Irving: We will bring magic to match it, so make an appointment between us and you in some convenient place which neither we nor you will break."

59.T.B.Irving: He said: "Your appointment will be on Decoration Day so that people may be summoned early in the morning."

60.T.B.Irving: So Pharaoh turned away and put his plan together; then he came [back].

61.T.B.Irving: Moses told them: "Watch out for yourselves! Don´t invent any lie about God lest He blot you out through torment. Anyone who invents things will be disappointed."

62.T.B.Irving: They debated their case among themselves and kept the discussion secret.

63.T.B.Irving: They said: "These are both magicians who want to expel you from your land by means of their magic, and do away with your exemplary ways.

64.T.B.Irving: Get together for your scheme; then come all lined up. Whoever comes out on top today will prosper!"

65.T.B.Irving: They said: "Moses, either you will cast [something] or shall we be the first to cast [a spell]?"

66.T.B.Irving: He said: "Rather you throw [first]." You should have seen their ropes and rods! It appeared to him as if they were moving around because of their magic,

67.T.B.Irving: so Moses conceived a fear within himself.

68.T.B.Irving: We said: "Do not act afraid: you will come out on top!

69.T.B.Irving: Throw down what is in your right hand so it will swallow up anything they have produced. What they have produced is only some magician´s trick, and no magician succeeds no matter where he goes."

70.T.B.Irving: So the magicians threw themselves down on their knees. They said: "We believe in the Lord of Aaron and Moses."

71.T.B.Irving: He said: "Have you believed in Him before I permit you to? He must be your chief who has taught you magic! I´ll cut your hands and feet off on opposite sides, and have you crucified on the trunks of datepalms, so you may know which of us is harsher with torment and going to last longer."

72.T.B.Irving: They said: "We will never choose you before explanations have come to us nor ahead of the One Who originated us. Decide anything you may decide; you are no judge: You will only decide during this worldly life.

73.T.B.Irving: We believe in our Lord, so He may forgive us our mistakes as well as for any magic you have compelled us to perform. God is Better and more Enduring."

74.T.B.Irving: Anyone who comes to his Lord as a criminal will have HELL [as his reward]; he will neither die in it, nor yet will he live [a decent life].

75.T.B.Irving: Whoever comes to Him as a believer has performed honorable deeds; those will have the highest ranks,

76.T.B.Irving: the gardens of Eden through which rivers flow, to live in forever. That will be the reward for anyone who becomes purified.

77.T.B.Irving: We inspired Moses [as follows]: "Travel with My servants at night and open up a dry road through the sea for them. Do not fear being overtaken nor dread anything."

78.T.B.Irving: Pharaoh had them pursued by his troops, and the flood overwhelmed them as only it could overwhelm them.

79.T.B.Irving: Pharaoh led his folk astray and did not guide [them].

80.T.B.Irving: Children of Israel, We saved you from your enemy and made an appointment for you on the right side of the Mountain, and sent down manna and quail for you.

81.T.B.Irving: "Eat some of the wholesome things We have provided you with and do not act arrogantly while doing so, lest My anger light upon you; anyone My anger lights upon will surely collapse.

82.T.B.Irving: Yet I am quite Forgiving towards anyone who turns (in repentance) and believes, and acts honorably; then he will be guided."

83.T.B.Irving: "Whatever made you hurry away from your people, Moses?"

84.T.B.Irving: He said: "They were close upon my tracks, while I have hastened to You, my Lord, so You may feel pleased."

85.T.B.Irving: He said: "We have tested your folk in your absence and the Samaritan has led them astray."

86.T.B.Irving: Moses returned to his people angry, sorrowful. He said: "My folk, did your Lord not make you a handsome promise? Did the agreement seem too long in reaching you, or did you want anger from your Lord to settle upon you, so that you broke the appointment to meet Me?"

87.T.B.Irving: They said: "We did not break your appointment of our own accord, but we had to carry loads of the people´s ornaments and toss them [into a furnace]. That is what the Samaritan suggested."

88.T.B.Irving: He produced a calf for them in the shape of a body that mooed. They said: "This is your god, the god of Moses; he has forgotten [it]."

89.T.B.Irving: Did they not consider it would not talk back to them, nor control any harm or advantage for them?

90.T.B.Irving: Now Aaron had already told them: "My people, you are only being tested by means of it. Your Lord is the Mercy-giving, so follow me and obey my command!"

91.T.B.Irving: They said: "We will never quit being devoted to it until Moses returns to us."

92.T.B.Irving: He said: "Aaron, what prevented you, when you saw they had strayed

93.T.B.Irving: from having them follow me? Did you disobey my order?"

94.T.B.Irving: He said: "My (blood) brother, do not seize me by my beard nor by my head! I dreaded you would say: ´You have brought dissension to the Children of Israel and did not observe what I said."´

95.T.B.Irving: He said: "What have you been trying to do, 0 Samaritan?"

96.T.B.Irving: He said: "I noticed something they do not notice, so I snatched a handful from the messenger´s footprints and flung it away. Thus my soul has lured me on."

97.T.B.Irving: He said: "Go away! During your lifetime you will say: ´Don´t touch [me]!´ You have an appointment [for your torment] which will not be broken. Look at your god which you have become so devoted to: we shall burn it up, then scatter its remains in the flood."

98.T.B.Irving: Your God is God [Alone]; there is no other deity than Him! He is Vaster than everything in knowledge.

99.T.B.Irving: Thus We relate some news to you about what has occurred previously; We have even brought you a Reminder from Our very presence.

100.T.B.Irving: Anyone who evades it will bear a burden on Resurrection Day

101.T.B.Irving: which he will remain with. Evil will be such a load for them on Resurrection Day,

102.T.B.Irving: the day when the Trumpet shall be blown. We shall summon bleary-eyed criminals on that day.

103.T.B.Irving: They will mutter to one another: "Did you only stay away ten [days]?"

104.T.B.Irving: We are quite Aware of what they will say when the best behaved among them will say,. "You have only stayed away a day!"

105.T.B.Irving: They will ask you about the mountains, SO SAY: "My Lord will crumble them into powder

106.T.B.Irving: and leave them as flat as a prairie.

107.T.B.Irving: You will see no rough spots nor any unevenness on them.

108.T.B.Irving: On that day they will follow the Crier who has no crookedness in him either; their voices will be hushed before the Mercy-giving and you will hear only [people] shuffling past.

109.T.B.Irving: On that day intercession will only benefit someone whom the Mercygiving has permitted to enjoy it, and whose statement has pleased Him.

110.T.B.Irving: He knows what lies in front of them and what is behind them, while they do not embrace any knowledge about Him.

111.T.B.Irving: Faces will seem downcast before the Living, the Eternal, and anyone who carries a load of harm will have blundered,

112.T.B.Irving: while anyone who has performed honorable deeds and is a believer will need fear no harm nor any injustice.

113.T.B.Irving: Thus We have sent it down as an Arabic reading and set forth some of the Threat in it so that they may do their duty, or so it will arouse them to remember.

114.T.B.Irving: Exalted is God, the True Controller! Do not hurry while reading [the Quran] before its revelation has been accomplished for you, and [rather] SAY: "My Lord, increase me in knowledge!"

115.T.B.Irving: We had already made a pledge with Adam which he forgot. We found he had no determination.

116.T.B.Irving: When We told the angels: "Bow down on your knees before Adam," they [all] knelt down except for Diabolis; he refused [to do so].

117.T.B.Irving: We said: "Adam, this is an enemy for both you and your wife. Do not let him turn either of you out of the Garden, so you will regret it.

118.T.B.Irving: You have so much in it that you need go neither hungry nor naked;

119.T.B.Irving: you will neither thirst there nor fell sunstruck."

120.T.B.Irving: Satan whispered to him; he said: "Adam, shall I lead you to the Tree of Immortality and such control as will never disappear?"

121.T.B.Irving: So they both ate some of it, and their private parts became apparent to them. They set to patching themselves over with leaves from the Garden. Adam had disobeyed his Lord and was misled!

122.T.B.Irving: Later on his Lord chose him, and He relented towards him and guided [him].

123.T.B.Irving: He said: "Clear out of here, both of you together! Some of you [will become] enemies of others. Should guidance ever come to you from Me, no one who follows My guidance shall ever stray away nor regret it;

124.T.B.Irving: while anyone who fails to remember Me will have a meager living and We shall summon him as a blind person on Resurrection Day.

125.T.B.Irving: He will say: "My Lord, why have you summoned me as a blind person when was I sighted?"

126.T.B.Irving: He will say: "Thus did Our signs come to you, and you forgot them; that is why you have been forgotten today."´

127.T.B.Irving: Thus We reward anyone who overdoes things and does not believe in his Lord´s signs. Torment in the Hereafter will be even more severe and everlasting.

128.T.B.Irving: Did it not guide them [to see] how many generations We had wiped out before them whose dwellings they walk around in? In that are signs for persons who are wary.

129.T.B.Irving: If word had not already gone ahead from your Lord, it would have been made compulsory and a deadline set.

130.T.B.Irving: So be patient about anything they may say and hymn your Lord´s praise before the sun´s rise and before its setting, and in the small hours of the night. Hymn it as well at the ends of the day so that you may meet approval.

131.T.B.Irving: Do not strain your eyes towards what We let some types of them enjoy, the blossoming of worldly life, so We may test them by means of it. Your Lord´s provision is better and more lasting.

132.T.B.Irving: Order your household to pray and to discipline themselves by means of it. We do not ask you for any provision; yet We will provide for you, and the outcome rests on doing your duty.

133.T.B.Irving: They say: "If he would only bring us some sign from his Lord!" Has not evidence already reached them about what was in the early scriptures?

134.T.B.Irving: If We were to wipe them out ahead of time with torment, they would say: "Our Lord, if You had only sent us a messenger, we would have followed Your signs before we were humbled and disgraced."

135.T.B.Irving: SAY: "Everyone lives in expectation, so be on the lookout! You will know who are [your] companions along the Level Road and who has been guided.

1.T.B.Irving: Men turn aside through indifference even though their reckoning approaches.

2.T.B.Irving: No fresh reminder ever comes to them from their Lord except they listen to it as they play away,

3.T.B.Irving: their hearts distracted. Those who do wrong consult together privately; "Isn´t this [man] just a human being like yourselves? Will you succumb to magic while you can see it happening?"

4.T.B.Irving: SAY: "My Lord knows whatever is spoken in Heaven and Earth; He is Alert, Aware."

5.T.B.Irving: "Rather", they say, "it´s a jumble of dreams! In fact, he has made it all up! Indeed, he´s a poet. Let him bring us a sign such as the first men were sent with."

6.T.B.Irving: No town that ever believed before have We wiped out. Will they believe?

7.T.B.Irving: Before you We have sent only men whom We inspired. Ask people with [long] memories if you do not know it already.

8.T.B.Irving: We did not grant them bodies which did not eat food, nor were they immortal.

9.T.B.Irving: Then We confirmed the Promise for them, and saved them as well as anyone We wished to, and wiped out those who were dissipated.

10.T.B.Irving: We have sent down a Book to you which contains your Reminder. Will you not use your reason?

11.T.B.Irving: How many a town which had been doing wrong did We demolish, and raise up other folk in its stead?

12.T.B.Irving: When they felt Our might [approaching], they rushed headlong away from it!

13.T.B.Irving: Do not rush away; return to what you were luxuriating in and your dwellings, so that you may be questioned.

14.T.B.Irving: They say: "Alas for us! We have been doing wrong."

15.T.B.Irving: Such an appeal as theirs will never cease until We leave them withered away like a crop in need of harvesting.

16.T.B.Irving: We did not create Heaven and Earth and whatever lies in between them while just playing around.

17.T.B.Irving: If We had wanted to adopt it as a pastime, We would have adopted it within Our very presence, had We ever done so.

18.T.B.Irving: Rather We hurl Truth against falsehood, so it knocks it down. Then it disappears. You are the ones [who need] to worry because of what you are describing.

19.T.B.Irving: He owns whoever is in Heaven and Earth. Anyone who is with Him is never too proud to do Him service, nor are they even wearied;

20.T.B.Irving: they celebrate [Him] night and day; they never pause.

21.T.B.Irving: Or have they taken gods from earth who will raise the dead?

22.T.B.Irving: If there were other gods in either [Heaven or Earth] besides God [Alone], they would both dissolve in chaos. Glory be to God, Lord of the Throne, beyond what they describe!

23.T.B.Irving: He will not be questioned about what He does, while they shall be so questioned.

24.T.B.Irving: Yet do they still adopt other gods instead of Him? SAY: "Bring on your proof! This is a Reminder for anyone who is with me, as well as a Reminder for whoever came before me." Instead, most of them do not recognize the Truth, so they avoid it.

25.T.B.Irving: We did not send any messenger before you unless We inspired him with the fact there is no deity except Me, so serve Me!

26.T.B.Irving: They say: "The Mercy-giving has adopted a son." Glory be to Him! Rather they are honored servants;

27.T.B.Irving: they do not try to speak ahead of Him, while they act at His command.

28.T.B.Irving: He knows what lies in front of them and what is behind them; while they do not intercede except for someone who has been approved. They are apprehensive and hence in awe of Him.

29.T.B.Irving: Should any of them say: "I am a god as well as He," that person We shall reward with Hell. Thus We reward wrongdoers!

30.T.B.Irving: Have not those who disbelieve seen how Heaven and Earth were once one solid mass which We ripped apart? We have made every living thing out of water. Will they still not believe?

31.T.B.Irving: We have placed headlands on earth lest it should sway while they are on it, and have placed mountain passes on it as highways so they may be guided.

32.T.B.Irving: We have placed the sky as a roof which is held up even though they shun its signs!

33.T.B.Irving: He is the One Who has created night and daylight, and the sun and the moon; each floats along in an orbit.

34.T.B.Irving: We have not granted immortality to any human being before you; so if you should die, will they become immortal?

35.T.B.Irving: Every soul shall taste death. We will test you (all) with something bad and something good as a trial; then to Us will you be returned!

36.T.B.Irving: Whenever those who disbelieve see you, they never accept you unless it is to ridicule you: "Is this the person who mentions your gods?", while they disown any mention of the Mercy-giving!

37.T.B.Irving: Man has been created from impatience. I will show you My signs so do not try to hurry Me up.

38.T.B.Irving: They say: "When will this promise be, if you are (all) so truthful?"

39.T.B.Irving: If those who disbelieve only knew about the time when they will not fend the Fire off from their faces nor from their backs, nor will they be supported.

40.T.B.Irving: Rather it will come upon them suddenly and dumbfound them; they will not manage to cast it off nor will they be allowed to wait.

41.T.B.Irving: Messengers have been ridiculed before you, till whatever they were sneering at swept in around those who had been ridiculing them."

42.T.B.Irving: SAY: "Who shields you night and day from the Mercy-giving?." Indeed they are evasive about mentioning their Lord!

43.T.B.Irving: Or do they have gods who can defend them from Us? They can neither assist themselves nor yet are they accompanied by Us.

44.T.B.Irving: Rather We have let such persons and their forefathers enjoy themselves until life seems to last too long for them. Do they not see how We come to the earth to clip it off along its borders? Will they turn out to be the winners?

45.T.B.Irving: SAY: "I am warning you only through inspiration." The deaf will not hear the Appeal even when they are warned [directly];

46.T.B.Irving: if a breath from your Lord´s torment should ever touch them, they would say: "It´s too bad for us! We have been doing wrong."

47.T.B.Irving: We shall set up scales for justice on Resurrection Day, and no soul will be dealt with unjustly in any way. Even if the weight of a mustard seed should exist, We would bring it along; sufficient are We as Reckoners!

48.T.B.Irving: We brought Moses and Aaron the Standard and radiance, plus a Reminder for the heedful,

49.T.B.Irving: [all those] who dread their Lord even though [He is] Unseen. They are (also) anxious about the Hour.

50.T.B.Irving: This is a blessed Reminder We have sent down; so why are you (all) so distrustful concerning it?

51.T.B.Irving: We gave Abraham his integrity long ago, and We were (fully) Conscious of him

52.T.B.Irving: when he told his father and his folk: "What are these images which you are so devoted to?"

53.T.B.Irving: They said: "We found our forefathers serving them."

54.T.B.Irving: He said: "You and your forefathers have been in such obvious error."

55.T.B.Irving: They said: "Have you brought us the Truth, or are you just a trifler?"

56.T.B.Irving: He said: "Rather your Lord is the Lord of Heaven and Earth, and the One Who originated them, while I am another witness for that.

57.T.B.Irving: By God, I am planning to confound your idols once you have turned your backs!"

58.T.B.Irving: So he broke them into fragments except for the biggest one of them, so that they might return to [question] it.

59.T.B.Irving: They said: "Who did this to our gods? He must be some wrongdoer!"

60.T.B.Irving: They said: "We heard a young man mentioning them; he is called Abraham."

61.T.B.Irving: They said: "Bring him before the people´s eyes so they may witness it."

62.T.B.Irving: They said: "Is it you who has done this to our gods, Abraham?"

63.T.B.Irving: He said: "Rather this biggest one of them did it. Ask them, if they are able to speak up."

64.T.B.Irving: They turned to one another and said: "You yourselves are the wrongdoers!"

65.T.B.Irving: Then they hung their heads: "You knew those things do not utter [a word]."

66.T.B.Irving: He said: "So do you worship something instead of God that neither benefits you in any way nor does it harm you?

67.T.B.Irving: Shame on you and on whatever you worship instead of God [Alone]! Don´t you use your reason?"

68.T.B.Irving: They said: "Burn him up and support your gods if you must be doing something!"

69.T.B.Irving: We said: "Fire, be cool, and safe for Abraham!"

70.T.B.Irving: They wanted to outwit him, so We made them lose the most.

71.T.B.Irving: We rescued him and Lot, [bringing them] to a land which We had blessed for [everyone in] the Universe.

72.T.B.Irving: We bestowed Isaac and (then) Jacob on him as an additional boon; each We made into honorable men.

73.T.B.Irving: We made them leaders who guided (others) by Our command and We inspired them to perform good deeds, keep up prayer, and pay the welfare tax. They have been serving Us.

74.T.B.Irving: And Lot We gave discretion and knowledge, and saved him from the town which had been performing wicked deeds. They had been such evil folk, perverts.

75.T.B.Irving: We admitted him into Our mercy; he was such an honorable man!

76.T.B.Irving: When Noah had cried out previously, We responded to him, and saved him and his family from serious distress.

77.T.B.Irving: We delivered him from a folk who had rejected Our signs. They had been such evil folk that We drowned them all.

78.T.B.Irving: And when David and Solomon both passed judgment on the field where some people´s sheep had strayed to pasture there at night, We acted as Witnesses for their decision.

79.T.B.Irving: We made Solomon understand it. Each We gave discretion and knowledge, and We let David develop the mountains and the birds which celebrate [Us]. We were Active [in this].

80.T.B.Irving: We taught him how to manufacture coats [of mail] for you, to protect you from your own violence. Yet are you ever grateful?

81.T.B.Irving: Solomon had wind as a storm which blew at his command over the earth which We had blessed. We were Conscious of everything.

82.T.B.Irving: Some devils there were who dived for him and performed other work besides that. We acted as Guardians over them.

83.T.B.Irving: And Job, when he cried out to his Lord: "Adversity has afflicted me while You are the most Merciful of the Mercy-granting!",

84.T.B.Irving: We responded to him and removed any adversity he was facing, and We gave him his household and the same as them besides, as a Mercy from Our presence and a Reminder for worshippers.

85.T.B.Irving: And Ishmael, Idris and [Ezekiel] with the Commission-were all patient.

86.T.B.Irving: We admitted them to Our mercy; they were honorable.

87.T.B.Irving: And the Man in the Whale when he stormed off angrily, and thought We would never have any power over him; yet he cried out in the darkness: "There is no deity except You! Glory be to You! I have been a wrongdoer."

88.T.B.Irving: We responded to him and saved him from grief. Thus We save believers.

89.T.B.Irving: And Zachariah when he cried out to his Lord: "My Lord, do not leave me childless, even though You are the Best of heirs."

90.T.B.Irving: We responded to him and bestowed John on him, and restored his wife [to childbearing] for him. They had always competed in doing good deeds and appealed to Us eagerly yet reverently. They were so humble towards Us.

91.T.B.Irving: And she who guarded her chastity, so We breathed some of Our spirit into her, and set both her and her son up as a sign for [everyone in] the Universe.

92.T.B.Irving: This community of yours [forms] one nation, while I am your Lord, so worship Me.

93.T.B.Irving: They have carved up their own affair among themselves; yet everyone will be returning to Us.

94.T.B.Irving: Anyone who performs some honorable deeds while he is a believer will never have his effort spurned. We will be Writing it down for him.

95.T.B.Irving: Yet a ban has been placed on any town We have wiped out; they shall not return

96.T.B.Irving: until when things are opened up for Gog and Magog and they come swarming down from every hillside

97.T.B.Irving: and the true Promise is approaching: then behold it will be staring into the eyes of those who have disbelieved: ´Alas for us! We have been so heedless concerning this. Indeed we were wrongdoers."

98.T.B.Irving: You and anything you worship instead of God [will serve as] pavement for Hell! You are being led to it;

99.T.B.Irving: if those had been gods, they would not have been led there; yet everyone will remain in it forever.

100.T.B.Irving: They will [find people] moaning in it while they will not [be able to] hear in it.

101.T.B.Irving: Those whose finest deeds have preceded them will be sent far away from it by Us;

102.T.B.Irving: they will not hear it even as a rustle while they will live forever in what they themselves have been longing for.

103.T.B.Irving: The greatest dismay will not sadden them while angels will welcome them with: "This is your Day which you have been promised!"

104.T.B.Irving: [It will be] a day when We shall roll up the sky just as a scroll for books is rolled up; just as We began with the first creation, so We shall do it all over again as a promise binding on Us which We have been Acting on.

105.T.B.Irving: We have written in the Psalms following the Reminder; "My honorable servants shall inherit the earth."
