106.T.B.Irving: In this is a proclamation for folk who are worshipful.

107.T.B.Irving: We have merely sent you as a mercy for [everybody in] the Universe.

108.T.B.Irving: SAY: "It has only been revealed to me that your god is God Alone. Are you committed to (live in] peace?"

109.T.B.Irving: If they should turn away, then SAY: "I have announced it to you all alike. If I only knew whether what you are promised is near or far away!"

110.T.B.Irving: He knows anything one says out loud and He (also) knows whatever you conceal.

111.T.B.Irving: If I only knew whether it may mean a trial for you as well as enjoyment for a while."

112.T.B.Irving: He said: "My Lord, judge with Truth," and "Our Lord is the Mercygiving Whose help is sought against what you describe."

1.T.B.Irving: 0 mankind, heed your Lord! The quaking at the Hour will be a serious matter.

2.T.B.Irving: On the day when you see it, every nursing mother will neglect whatever she is nursing and every pregnant female will miscarry. You will see men drunk while they have not been drinking. However God´s torment is severe!

3.T.B.Irving: Some men argue about God without having any knowledge, and they follow every willful Satan.

4.T.B.Irving: It has been written down concerning anyone he befriends that he shall mislead him and guide him to the torment of the Blaze.

5.T.B.Irving: 0 men, if you have ever been in doubt about rising again, well We (first) created you from dust; then from a drop of semen; then from a clot; then from a lump of tissue either shaped or else shapeless, so We might explain [things] to you. We cause anything We wish to rest in wombs for a stated period; then We bring you forth as infants; eventually you reach full growth. Some of you will pass away [early in life], while others of you will be sent back to the feeblest age of all, so that he will not know a thing after once having had knowledge. You see the barren earth when We send water down upon it, stirring, sprouting and producing every sort of lovely species.

6.T.B.Irving: That [comes about] because God is the Truth: He revives the dead and is Capable of everything!

7.T.B.Irving: The Hour is coming, there is no doubt about it. God will raise up whoever are in [their] graves.

8.T.B.Irving: Yet some men argue about God without having any knowledge or guidance, nor any enlightening Book,

9.T.B.Irving: twisting things around in order to lead [others] astray from God´s way. Such a man will have disgrace in this world while We shall let him taste the torment of burning on Resurrection Day.

10.T.B.Irving: "That is because of what your hands have sent on ahead." Yet God is no One to harm [His] worshippers.

11.T.B.Irving: Some men serve God along the fringes: if some good should happen to him, he accepts it calmly, while if some trial should strike him, he turns over on his face [in despair]. He loses both this world and the Hereafter. That is such an obvious loss!

12.T.B.Irving: He appeals to something that neither harms him nor yet benefits him, instead of to God. That is extreme error;

13.T.B.Irving: he appeals to someone whose harm is closer than his benefit. How wretched is such a patron; how wretched is such a colleague!

14.T.B.Irving: God will show those who believe and perform honorable deeds into gardens through which rivers flow; God does anything He wants.

15.T.B.Irving: Let anyone who has been thinking that God will never support him in this world as well as in the Hereafter, [try to] stretch a tent-rope up to the sky; then cut it off. Let him see whether his scheme will take away whatever is irritating him.

16.T.B.Irving: Thus We have sent it down as clear signs. God guides anyone He wants to.

17.T.B.Irving: God will sort out those who believe, as well as those who have become Jews, Sabeans, Christians, Magians, from those who associate [others with Him], on Resurrection Day. God is a Witness for everything.

18.T.B.Irving: Have you not seen how whoever is in Heaven and whoever is on earth drops down on his knees before God, as well as the sun, moon and stars, the mountains, trees and animals, and many people, even some [of those] deserving torment? Anyone whom God weakens will have no one to honor him. God does anything He wishes.

19.T.B.Irving: Both [sets of] these opponents debate about their Lord. Those who disbelieve will have garments tailored out of fire for them; over their heads scalding water will be poured.

20.T.B.Irving: Anything in their stomachs as well as their skins will be melted by it.

21.T.B.Irving: They will have iron goads:

22.T.B.Irving: every time they may want to leave because of [their] gloom, they will be sent back to it: "Taste the torment of burning!"

23.T.B.Irving: God will show those who believe and perform honorable deeds into gardens through which rivers flow; there they will be decked out with gold and pearl bracelets while their clothing will be [made of] silk.

24.T.B.Irving: They have been guided to a wholesome way of talking as well as guided along the Praiseworthy´s road.

25.T.B.Irving: Those who disbelieve and obstruct God´s way and (block) the Hallowed Mosque which We have granted to mankind on the same footing-whether the one devoted to it[s care] or the nomad-yet We shall let anyone who wants to misuse it wrongfully, taste some painful torment.

26.T.B.Irving: Thus We settled Abraham at the site of the House [saying]: "Do not associate anything with Me, and purify My house for those who walk around it, and those who stand there [praying], and those who bow down on their knees in worship."

27.T.B.Irving: "Proclaim the Pilgrimage among mankind: they will come to you on foot and on every lean [beast of burden]; "let them come from every deep ravine,

28.T.B.Irving: to bear witness to the advantages they have, and to mention God´s name on appointed days over such heads of livestock as He has provided them with. So eat some of it and feed the needy pauper. "

29.T.B.Irving: Then let them attend to their grooming, fulfill their vows, and circle round the Ancient House."

30.T.B.Irving: That is [how it should be], and it will be best with one´s Lord for anyone who emphasizes God´s restrictions. You are permitted livestock except for those which have been listed for you. Avoid the filth of idols and refrain from deceptive speech,

31.T.B.Irving: seeking righteously after God, nor associating anything with Him. Anyone who associates anything with God [will feel] as if he had fallen out of the sky and the birds had snatched him away, or the wind had blown him to some far off place.

32.T.B.Irving: That is [how it is]. Anyone who emphasizes God´s ceremonies should do so from heartfelt heeding;

33.T.B.Irving: you have advantages in them for a fixed period, then their place shall be at the Ancient House.

34.T.B.Irving: To every nation We have granted ritual so they may mention God´s name over any heads of livestock He has provided them with. Your God is God Alone, so commit yourself to Him peacefully and proclaim good news to the meek,

35.T.B.Irving: whose hearts tremble whenever God is mentioned and are patient with anything that may happen to them, and those who keep up prayer and spend something out of whatever We have provided them with.

36.T.B.Irving: Animals´ bodies [to be sacrificed] We have granted to you as some of God´s symbols. They contain good for you, so mention God´s name over them as they are lined up [for slaughter]. Once they slump down on their sides, then eat some of them and feed both the [poor man who is] carefree and the one who insists on it. Thus We have subjected them to you so that you may be thankful.

37.T.B.Irving: Neither their meat nor their blood ever reaches God, but heedfulness on your part does reach Him. Thus He has subjected them to you, so that you may magnify God because He has guided you, and proclaim good news to those who act kindly.

38.T.B.Irving: God defends those who believe; God does not love every thankless traitor.

39.T.B.Irving: Those who have been wronged are permitted to fight [back]-since God is Able to support them-

40.T.B.Irving: any who have been driven from their homes unjustly, merely because they say: "Our Lord is God [Alone]." If it were not because God repels some men by means of others, cloisters, churches, synagogues and mosques where God´s name is mentioned frequently would have been demolished. God supports anyone who supports Him-God is Strong, Powerful -

41.T.B.Irving: those who, if We established them in the land, would keep up prayer and pay the welfare tax, command what is proper and forbid debauchery. God holds the destiny of things!

42.T.B.Irving: If they should reject you, well Noah´s folk and cad´s and Thamud´s (all) rejected [messengers] before them,

43.T.B.Irving: and [so did] Abraham´s folk and Lot´s folk,

44.T.B.Irving: -and the inhabitants of Midian; even Moses was rejected! I put up with disbelievers; then I seize them, and how [awful] is My repudiation!

45.T.B.Irving: How many towns have We wiped out while they were doing wrong?. Their rafters have fallen in, their wells have been abandoned, and [many an] impressive palace as well,

46.T.B.Irving: Have they not travelled around the earth so they may acquire hearts to reason with or ears to listen with? It is not their eyesight which is blind, but their hearts in their breasts which are blind.

47.T.B.Irving: They try to make you hurry up the torment! God will never go back on His promise; a day with your Lord is like a thousand years such as those you count by.

48.T.B.Irving: How many towns have I put up with while they were doing wrong! Then I have seized them, and towards Me lay the Goal!

49.T.B.Irving: SAY: "Mankind, I am merely a clear warner for you

50.T.B.Irving: and for those who believe and perform honorable deeds; they shall have forgiveness and generous provision,

51.T.B.Irving: while those who work against Our signs in order to frustrate them, will become the inmates of Hades."

52.T.B.Irving: We have never sent any messenger nor any prophet before you unless Satan interfered with his desire even while he desired something. God cancel will out whatever Satan tampers with; then God will decide on His signs. God is Aware, Wise,

53.T.B.Irving: so He may set up anything Satan has proposed as a trial for those whose hearts contain malice and whose hearts are hardened-wrongdoers are in such extreme dissension-

54.T.B.Irving: and so those who have been given knowledge should know that it means Truth from your Lord and they may believe in it, and their hearts yield to it. God acts as a Guide towards a Straight Road for those who believe.

55.T.B.Irving: Those who disbelieve will remain in a quandary concerning it until the Hour comes upon them suddenly or the torment of a desolate day reaches them.

56.T.B.Irving: Control will belong to God on that day; He will judge between them, and those who believe and perform honorable deeds will be in the gardens of Bliss.

57.T.B.Irving: Those who disbelieve and deny Our signs will have humiliating torment.

58.T.B.Irving: God will provide handsomely for those who migrate for God´s sake, then are killed or die. God is the Best Provider!

59.T.B.Irving: He will show them through an entrance they will be pleased with. God is so Aware, Lenient.

60.T.B.Irving: Such will it be. God will support anyone who retaliates insofar as he has suffered, then is set upon again; for God is Pardoning, Forgiving.

61.T.B.Irving: That is because God merges night into daylight and merges daylight into night. God is Alert, Observant.

62.T.B.Irving: That is because God is Truth, while anything they appeal to instead of Him is false. God is the Sublime, the Great,

63.T.B.Irving: Have you not seen how God sends down water from the sky, so the earth becomes verdant next morning? God is so Gracious, Informed.

64.T.B.Irving: He holds whatever is in Heaven and whatever is on Earth; God is the Transcendent, the Praiseworthy!

65.T.B.Irving: Have you not seen how God has subjected whatever is on earth to you, and the ships that sail at sea by His command? He holds back the sky from falling down on the earth except with His permission. God is so Gentle, Merciful towards mankind.

66.T.B.Irving: He is the One Who gives you life, then causes you to die; next He will revive you. Yet man is so ungrateful!

67.T.B.Irving: Each nation have We granted ritual they are devoted to, so do not let anyone argue with you about the matter. Appeal to your Lord; for you are following straight guidance.

68.T.B.Irving: If they should dispute with you, then say: "God is quite Aware as to what you are doing;

69.T.B.Irving: God will judge between you on Resurrection Day concerning what you (all) have been disagreeing about."

70.T.B.Irving: Do you not know that God knows whatever is in Heaven and Earth? That is [contained] in a Book; such a thing is easy for God!

71.T.B.Irving: Yet instead of God they worship something for which no authority has been sent down, and about which they have no knowledge. There is no supporter for wrongdoers.

72.T.B.Irving: Whenever Our clear signs are recited to them, you will recognize the disgust on the faces of those who disbelieve; they almost pounce upon those who recite Our verses to them! SAY: "Shall I announce something even worse than that to you? T Fire!" God has promised it to those who disbelieve. How awful is such a goal!

73.T.B.Irving: 0 mankind, a parable has been composed, so listen to it! Those whom you appeal to other than to God will never create a fly, even though they combined together to do so. Yet if the fly should snatch anything away from them, they would not even know how to recover it from it. How weak the seeker is, and anything he seeks!

74.T.B.Irving: They cannot measure God according to His true power. God is Strong, Powerful.

75.T.B.Irving: God selects messengers from both angels and from mankind; God is Alert, Observant.

76.T.B.Irving: He knows what lies in front of them and what stands behind them; to God do (all) matters return.

77.T.B.Irving: You who believe, bow down and kneel before [Him], and worship your Lord; and do good, so that you may succeed.

78.T.B.Irving: Strive for God´ sake, the way He should be striven for. He has picked you out and has not placed any constraint upon you concerning [your] religion, the sect of your forefather Abraham. He has named you Muslims both previously and right now, so the Messenger may be a witness for you, and you may act as witnesses for mankind. Keep up prayer and pay the welfare tax, and cling firmly to God; He is your Protector. What a splendid Protector, and what a splendid Supporter!

1.T.B.Irving: Believers will succeed!

2.T.B.Irving: [This means] those who are reverent in their prayer,

3.T.B.Irving: who refrain from idle talk,

4.T.B.Irving: who are active in [promoting] public welfare

5.T.B.Irving: and who guard their private parts

6.T.B.Irving: except with their spouses and whomever their right hands may control, since then they are free from blame.

7.T.B.Irving: Those who hanker after anything beyond that are going too far!

8.T.B.Irving: And those who preserve their trusts and their pledge,

9.T.B.Irving: and who attend to their prayers,

10.T.B.Irving: will be the heirs

11.T.B.Irving: who shall inherit Paradise to live there forever.

12.T.B.Irving: We created man from an extract of clay;

13.T.B.Irving: then We placed him as a drop of semen in a secure resting-place.

14.T.B.Irving: Then We turned the semen into a clot; next We turned the clot into tissue; and then We turned the tissue into bones and clothed the bones with flesh. Then We reproduced him as a fresh creation. Blessed be God, the Best of Creators!

15.T.B.Irving: Then later on you shall die.

16.T.B.Irving: Next you will be raised up again on Resurrection Day.

17.T.B.Irving: We have created seven orbits above you; We have not been heedless about creation.

18.T.B.Irving: We send down water from the sky in due measure, and let it trickle into the earth. We are even Able to make it disappear.

19.T.B.Irving: We have produced date groves and vineyards on it for you; from which you have much fruit to eat,

20.T.B.Irving: as well as a tree growing on Mount Sinai which produces oil and seasoning for those who [want to] eat.

21.T.B.Irving: You have [still another] lesson in livestock: We let you drink what is in their bellies, and you have many [other] uses in them; some of them you eat,

22.T.B.Irving: while on them and on shipboard are you transported.

23.T.B.Irving: We sent Noah to his folk, and he said: "My people, worship God; you have no other deity except Him. Will you not do your duty?"

24.T.B.Irving: The elders among his folk who disbelieved said: "This is only a human being like yourselves who wants to attain some superiority over you. If God had wished, He would have sent down angels [instead]. We never heard about this from our early forefathers.

25.T.B.Irving: He is only a man possessed by some sprite, so try to catch him off guard for a moment."

26.T.B.Irving: He said; "My Lord, support me in view of how they have rejected me!"

27.T.B.Irving: So We inspired him: "Build the ship under Our eyes and through Our inspiration. When Our command comes and the reservoir bursts open, send two out of every species on board as well as your own family, except for any of them against whom the Sentence has already been pronounced. Do not lecture Me about those who have done wrong: they will be drowned.

28.T.B.Irving: When you and anyone else who is with you have boarded the ship, then SAY: "Praise be to God, Who has saved us from such wicked folk!"

29.T.B.Irving: And (also) SAY: "My Lord, land me through a blessed landing; You are the best Harbormaster!" Unnamed Messengers

30.T.B.Irving: In that there were signs: We are always Testing (people).

31.T.B.Irving: Then We produced a generation of others after them;

32.T.B.Irving: We sent a messenger around from among themselves: "Serve God; you have no other deity except Him! Will you not do your duty?")

33.T.B.Irving: The elders among his people who disbelieved and denied there would be any meeting in the Hereafter, even though We had granted them every luxury during worldly life, said: "This is only a human being like yourselves; he eats what you eat, and drinks what you drink.

34.T.B.Irving: If you obey a human being just like yourselves, you will then turn out to be losers.

35.T.B.Irving: Does he promise you that when you die and have become dust and bones, that you will be brought forth again?

36.T.B.Irving: Away, off with whatever you are threatened with!

37.T.B.Irving: There exists only our present life; we die even as we live, and shall not be raised up again.

38.T.B.Irving: He is only a man who has invented some lie about God, and we do not believe in him."

39.T.B.Irving: He said: "My Lord, support me because they have rejected me!"

40.T.B.Irving: He said: "Some morning soon they will feel regretful."

41.T.B.Irving: The Blast really caught them and We turned them into rubbish. Away with such wicked folk!

42.T.B.Irving: Then We raised up other generations after them.

43.T.B.Irving: No nation may anticipate its deadline nor will they ever postpone it.

44.T.B.Irving: Then We sent Our messengers one after another. Each time its messenger came to some nation, they rejected him, so We followed some of them up with others and turned them into conversation pieces. Away with any folk who will not believe!

45.T.B.Irving: Next We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our signs and clear authority

46.T.B.Irving: to Pharaoh and his courtiers, and they acted too proudly and were such haughty folk.

47.T.B.Irving: So they said: "Are we to believe in two human beings like ourselves while their people are slaving for us?"

48.T.B.Irving: They rejected them both, and so eventually were wiped out.

49.T.B.Irving: Yet We had given Moses the Book so that they might be guided.

50.T.B.Irving: We set up the son of Mary and his mother as a sign, and sheltered them both on a hilltop where there was both lodging and a spring.

51.T.B.Irving: 0 messengers, eat wholesome things and act honorably; I am Aware of anything you do.

52.T.B.Irving: This nation of yours [forms] one community while I am your Lord, so heed me!

53.T.B.Irving: Yet they carve up their business into cartels among themselves, each faction happy with whatever lies before them.

54.T.B.Irving: Leave them in their excitement for a while.

55.T.B.Irving: Do they reckon that We have only afforded them wealth and children because of it?

56.T.B.Irving: We hurry good things up for them, yet they do not even notice it!

57.T.B.Irving: Those who feel anxious out of awe for their Lord,

58.T.B.Irving: and those who believe in their Lord´s signs,

59.T.B.Irving: and those who do not associate anything with their Lord,

60.T.B.Irving: and those who give away anything they may give while their hearts feel wary lest they should return to their Lord;

61.T.B.Irving: [all] those compete in doing good deeds and they will soon attain them.

62.T.B.Irving: We only assign a soul something it can cope with. Before Us lies a Book which speaks up for Truth; they will not be dealt with unjustly.

63.T.B.Irving: Instead their hearts are full of excitement because of this. They have other deeds besides those which they are committing,

64.T.B.Irving: so that whenever We seize their high-livers with torment, just imagine how they bellow!

65.T.B.Irving: "Do not roar [so loud] today; you will not be supported by Us.

66.T.B.Irving: My signs have already been recited to you while you proudly turned on your heels

67.T.B.Irving: away from it, sitting up nights to chatter on and on about it."

68.T.B.Irving: Have they not reflected on the Sentence, whether something that never reached their earliest forefathers may not have come to them?

69.T.B.Irving: Or do they not recognize their Messenger and are disgusted with him?

70.T.B.Irving: Or do they say: "Some [mad] sprite possesses him!"? Rather he has brought them the Truth, while most of them hate the Truth.

71.T.B.Irving: If Truth had followed their whims, Heaven and Earth would have collapsed in chaos, along with anyone who is in them. Rather We have brought them their Reminder, yet they keep avoiding their Reminder.

72.T.B.Irving: Or are you asking them [to make] some outlay´? Your Lord´s tribute is best, for He is the Best Provider!

73.T.B.Irving: You are calling them to [follow] a Straight Road

74.T.B.Irving: while those who do not believe in the Hereafter go swerving off the Road.

75.T.B.Irving: Even if We showed them mercy and removed any trouble that worries them, they would still blindly persist in their arrogance.

76.T.B.Irving: We had already seized them with torment yet they did not surrender to their Lord nor beseech [Him]

77.T.B.Irving: until just as We opened up a gate for them leading to severe torment, why they were dumbfounded by it!

78.T.B.Irving: He is the One Who has furnished you with hearing, eyesight and vital organs; yet how seldom are you grateful!

79.T.B.Irving: He is the One Who has scattered you over the earth, and to him shall you be summoned.

80.T.B.Irving: He is the One Who gives life and brings death; He controls the alternation between night and daylight. Will you not reason?

81.T.B.Irving: Instead they say the same thing as the first men said;

82.T.B.Irving: they say: "When we have died and become dust and bones, will we be raised UP again?"

83.T.B.Irving: This was promised us and our forefathers long ago. These a only legends (made up] by primitive people!"

84.T.B.Irving: SAY: "Who owns the earth and anyone on it, if you know [anything]?"

85.T.B.Irving: They will say : "It is God´s." SAY: "Will you not bear it in mind?"

86.T.B.Irving: SAY: "Who is Lord of the Seven Heavens and Lord of the splendid Throne?"

87.T.B.Irving: They will say: "They are God´s." SAY: "Will you do not your duty [by Him]?"

88.T.B.Irving: SAY: "In Whose hand lies sovereignty over everything? He protects, while against Him there is no protection, if you but realized it."

89.T.B.Irving: They will say: "It is in God´s." SAY: "How is it you act so bewildered?"´

90.T.B.Irving: Rather We have brought them the Truth while they deny it

91.T.B.Irving: God has not adopted any son, nor is there any [other] deity alongside Him, otherwise each god would carry off whatever it has created, and some of them would gain the upper hand over others. Glory be to God beyond what they describe!

92.T.B.Irving: Knower of the Unseen and the Visible: Exalted is He over anything they may associate [with Him)?

93.T.B.Irving: SAY: "My Lord, will you show me what they are threatened with?

94.T.B.Irving: My Lord, do not place me among such wrongdoing folk!"

95.T.B.Irving: We are Able indeed to show you whatever We are threatening them with!

96.T.B.Irving: Repay evil with something that is finer; We are quite Aware of anything they describe.

97.T.B.Irving: SAY: "My Lord, I seek refuge with You from the devils promptings.

98.T.B.Irving: I seek refuge with you, my Lord, lest they accompany me,

99.T.B.Irving: since whenever death comes to any one of them, he says: "My Lord, send me back

100.T.B.Irving: so I may act honorably with anything I may have left behind"´ Indeed not! It is merely a remark he is making. Beyond them there lies a barrier till the day when they will be raised up again.

101.T.B.Irving: Once the Trumpet is blown, no ties of kinship will exist between them on that day, nor may they question one another.

102.T.B.Irving: Those whose scales are heavy will be prosperous;

103.T.B.Irving: while those whose scales are light will be the ones who have lost their souls; they will remain in Hell.

104.T.B.Irving: The fire will scorch their faces while they will glower away in it.

105.T.B.Irving: "Were My signs not recited to you as you (all) were rejecting them?"

106.T.B.Irving: They will say: "Our Lord, our misery has overwhelmed us and we were errant folk.

107.T.B.Irving: Our Lord, get us out of here! If we ever should return [to disobedience], then we would indeed be wrongdoers."

108.T.B.Irving: He will say: "Sink down into it, and never speak to Me!

109.T.B.Irving: A group of My servants used to say: ´Our Lord, we believe, so forgive us and have mercy on us; You are the Best One to show mercy!´

110.T.B.Irving: You took them for a laughingstock until they made you forget to remember Me since you had been laughing so hard at them.

111.T.B.Irving: I have rewarded them today for how patient they have been; they are triumphant."

112.T.B.Irving: He will say [further]: "How many years did you stay on earth?"

113.T.B.Irving: They will say: "We stayed a day or part of a day. Ask the timekeepers."

114.T.B.Irving: He will say: "You only lasted a little while, if you only realized it.

115.T.B.Irving: Did you reckon We have created you just for fun and that you would never be returned to Us?"

116.T.B.Irving: Exalted is God, the true King! There is no deity except Him, Lord of the Noble Throne!

117.T.B.Irving: Anyone who appeals to any other deity along with God (Himself), has no proof for it. His reckoning rests only with his Lord. Disbelievers will not succeed.

118.T.B.Irving: SAY: "My Lord, forgive and show mercy! You are the Best One to show mercy!"

1.T.B.Irving: [This is] a chapter We have sent down and ordained. We send clear signs down in it so that you (all) may be reminded.

2.T.B.Irving: Flog both the adulterous woman and the adulterous man with a hundred lashes, and do not let any pity for either party distract you from [complying with] God´s religion if you believe in God and the Last Day. Have a group of believers witness their punishment.

3.T.B.Irving: An adulterous man may only marry an adulterous woman or one who associates [others with God]; while an adulterous woman may only be married to an adulterous man or one who associates [others with God]. Such [conduct] is forbidden to believers.

4.T.B.Irving: Flog those who cast things up at honorable matrons with eighty lashes unless they bring four witnesses, and never accept their testimony from them [again]. Those are troublemakers;

5.T.B.Irving: except for the ones who repent later on and reform. God is Forgiving, Merciful.

6.T.B.Irving: Any persons who accuse their spouses yet have no witnesses except themselves for it, should offer testimony by swearing four times before God that he is telling the truth,

7.T.B.Irving: plus a fifth [time] that God´s curse will rest on him if he is a liar.

8.T.B.Irving: It will avert the punishment. from her if she swears four times before God that he is a liar,

9.T.B.Irving: plus a fifth that God´s anger will rest on her if he has been truthful.

10.T.B.Irving: How would it be without God´s bounty and mercy towards you (all)? God is the Receiver of Repentance, Wise.

11.T.B.Irving: Those who have brought up such slander form a clique among you. Do not reckon it is a bad thing for you; rather it will be good for you: every last man of them shall be charged with whatever he has committed the way of an offence, while whoever has assumed his leadership over them [through such gossiping] will have serious torment.

12.T.B.Irving: If you believing men and believing women had only thought of something good by yourselves when you heard it, and said: "This is an obvious falsehood!"

13.T.B.Irving: If they had only brought four witnesses to [prove] it! When they did not bring any witnesses, those were liars before God.

14.T.B.Irving: If it had not been for God´s bounty towards you, as well as His mercy in this world and the Hereafter, some serious torment might have afflicted you because of the talk you had indulged in.

15.T.B.Irving: When you encountered it on your tongues and said something with your own mouths that you had no knowledge about, you reckoned it was trifling although it was serious with God.

16.T.B.Irving: If you had only said as you heard it: "We ought not to talk about this. Glory be to You! This is serious slander."

17.T.B.Irving: God cautions you never to repeat anything like it again if you are believers.

18.T.B.Irving: God explains signs to you; God is Aware, Wise.

19.T.B.Irving: Those who love to spread shocking news around concerning those who believe will have painful torment in this world and the Hereafter. God knows while you (all) do not know.

20.T.B.Irving: If God´s bounty and mercy had only rested on you; for God is Gentle, Merciful!

21.T.B.Irving: You who believe, do not follow in Satan´s footsteps. Satan orders anyone who follows in his footsteps to commit acts of sexual misconduct as well as dishonor. If it had not been for God´s bounty and mercy towards you, not one of you would have ever been pure; but God purifies anyone He wishes. God is Alert, Aware.

22.T.B.Irving: Those among you possessing resources and [other] means should not fail to give [something to] near relatives paupers and those who are refugees for God´s sake; let them act forgivingly and show indulgence. Do you not like God to pardon you? God is Forgiving, Merciful.

23.T.B.Irving: Those who cast things up at heedless [yet] believing matrons will be cursed in this world and the Hereafter. They will have severe torment

24.T.B.Irving: on a day when their tongues, their hands and their feet will testify against them concerning whatever they have been doing.

25.T.B.Irving: On that day God will repay them with their rightful due; they will realize that God means obvious Truth.

26.T.B.Irving: Bad women are for bad men, and bad men are for bad women; while good women are for good men, and good men are for good women. The latter are absolved from anything they may say; they will have and generous provision.

27.T.B.Irving: You who believe, do not enter any houses except your own homes unless you act politely and greet their occupants; that is best for you so you may remember.

28.T.B.Irving: If you do not find anyone in them, still do not enter them until permission has been granted you. If you are told: "Get out !", then turn back; it is more fitting for you. God is Aware of anything you do.

29.T.B.Irving: It will not be held against you, however, for entering any houses which are not inhabited, for some property belonging to you. God knows anything you show and anything you hide.

30.T.B.Irving: Tell believers to avert their glances and to guard their private parts; that is chaster for them. God is Informed about anything they may produce.

31.T.B.Irving: Tell believing women to avert their glances and guard their private parts, and not to display their charms except what [normally] appears of them. They should fold their shawls over their bosoms and show their charms only to their husbands, or their fathers or their fathers-in-law, or their own sons or stepsons, or their own brothers or nephews on either their brothers´ or their sisters´ side; or their own womenfolk, or anyone their right hands control, or male attendants who have no sexual desire, or children who have not yet shown any interest in women´s nakedness. Let them not stomp their feet in order to let any ornaments they may have hidden be noticed. Turn to God, all you believers, so that you may prosper!

32.T.B.Irving: Marry off any single persons among you, as well as your honorable servants and maids. If they are poor, God will enrich them from His bounty. God is Boundless, Aware.

33.T.B.Irving: Yet let those who do not find [any way to] marry, hold off until God enriches them out of His bounty. Should those whom your right hands control desire their freedom, then draw up such a writ for them if you recognize anything worthwhile in them. Give them some of God´s wealth which He has given you. Do not force your girls [whom you control] into prostitution so that you may seek the display of worldly life, if they want to preserve their chastity. Anyone who forces them (to do otherwise) [will find] God is Forgiving, Merciful, even after forcing them to.

34.T.B.Irving: We have sent you down clarifying signs and an example in those who have passed on before you, as well as instruction for the heedful.

35.T.B.Irving: God is the Light of Heaven and Earth! His light may be compared to a niche in which there is a lamp; the lamp is in a glass; the glass is just as if it were a glittering star kindled from a blessed olive tree, [which is] neither Eastern nor Western, whose oil will almost glow though fire has never touched it. Light upon light, God guides anyone He wishes to His light. God composes parables for mankind; God is Aware of everything!

36.T.B.Irving: There are houses God has permitted to be built where His name is mentioned; in them He is glorified morning and evening

37.T.B.Irving: by men whom neither business nor trading distract from remembering God, keeping up prayer, and paying the welfare tax. They fear a day when their hearts and eyesight will feel upset

38.T.B.Irving: unless God rewards them for the finest things they may have done, and gives them even more out of His bounty. God provides for anyone He wishes without any reckoning!

39.T.B.Irving: Those who disbelieve [will find] their deeds [will disappear] like a mirage on a desert: the thirsty man will reckon it is water till, as he comes up to it, he finds it is nothing. Yet he finds God [stands] beside him and he must render Him his account; God is Prompt in reckoning!

40.T.B.Irving: Or like darkness on the unfathomed sea: one wave covers up another wave, over which there [hang] clouds; layers of darkness, one above the other! When he stretches out his hand, he can scarcely see it. Anyone whom God does not grant light to will have no light!

41.T.B.Irving: Have you not seen how everyone in Heaven and Earth glorifies God, even to the birds lined up (in flight)? Each knows its prayer and how to glorify Him. God is Aware of whatever they do.

42.T.B.Irving: God holds control over Heaven and Earth; towards God lies the goal!

43.T.B.Irving: Have you not seen how God drives along the clouds, then masses them together, next piles them into layers? You see a downpour coming from inside of them; He sends down mountainous masses from the sky with cold hail in them, and pelts anyone He wishes with it and wards it off from anyone He wishes. A flash from His lightning almost takes one´s sight away!

44.T.B.Irving: God alternates night and daylight; in that there lies a lesson for those possessing insight.

45.T.B.Irving: God has created every animal out of water; some of them walk on their belly, while others walk on two legs and still others walk on four. God creates anything He wishes; God is Able [to do) everything!

46.T.B.Irving: We have sent clarifying signs down, and God guides anyone He wishes to a Straight Road.

47.T.B.Irving: They will say: "We believe in God and the Messenger, and we obey." Then a group of them will turn away even after that; those are not believers.

48.T.B.Irving: Whenever they are invited to [come to] God and His messenger so He may judge among them, watch how a group of them will shunt it aside.

49.T.B.Irving: Yet if they have the Truth on their side, they come to it voluntarily.

50.T.B.Irving: Does some malice lurk in their hearts? Either they act skeptical, or else they fear that God and His messenger will cheat them. In fact such persons are wrongdoers!

51.T.B.Irving: The only statement believers should make when they are invited to [meet with] God and His messenger, so He may judge among them, is: "We have heard, and are at your orders!´ Those persons will be successful.

52.T.B.Irving: Those who obey God and His messenger, and dread God and heed Him, will be triumphant.

53.T.B.Irving: They swear before God with their most solemn oaths that they would go forth if you ordered them to. SAY: Do not swear so; obedience will be recognized, God is Informed about anything you do."

54.T.B.Irving: SAY: "Obey God and obey the Messenger." If you should turn away he is responsible only for what he has been commissioned with while you are responsible for what you are commissioned with. If you obey him, you will be guided; the Messenger has only to announce things clearly.

55.T.B.Irving: God has promised to appoint those of you who believe and perform honorable deeds as [His] representatives on earth, just as He made those before them into (such) overlords, and to establish their religion for the which He has approved for them, and to change their fear into confidence They serve Me [Alone] and do not associate anything else with me. Those who disbelieve later on will be perverse.

56.T.B.Irving: Keep up prayer, pay the welfare tax, and obey the Messenger so that you may receive mercy.

57.T.B.Irving: Do not reckon those who disbelieve can ever frustrate things on earth; their lodging will be the Fire, and how wretched is such a goal!

58.T.B.Irving: You who believe, have those whom your right hands control and those of you who have not yet reached puberty, ask permission from you on three occasions: before the daybreak prayer; when you take off your clothes at noon [for a siesta]; and after the late evening prayer. You have three times for privacy. There is no objection for you nor for them outside those times as they move around you so some of you may wait on others. Thus God explains signs to you; God is Aware, Wise.

59.T.B.Irving: Whenever any children of yours reach puberty, let them ask permission just as those before them have had to ask for such permission. Thus God explains His signs to you; God is Aware, Wise.

60.T.B.Irving: Those [elderly] women sitting around [after their menopause] who no longer expect to marry will meet with no objection if they take off their [outer] clothing, though without displaying their charms. Yet it is best for them to act modestly. God is Alert, Aware.

61.T.B.Irving: It should not be held against the blind nor against the lame, nor against the lame, nor against the sick nor against yourselves, for your eating in your own homes or at your fathers´ or your mothers´ homes, or your brothers´ or your sisters´ homes, or at your uncles´ or aunts´ homes on your father´s side, or your uncles´ or aunts´ on your mother´s side, or those whose keys you have in your custody, or with some friends of yours. There is no objection to your eating either together or separately. Whenever you enter any houses, greet one another with a blessed, wholesome greeting by invoking God. Thus God explains [His] signs to you so that you may reason things out.

62.T.B.Irving: Believers are merely those who believe in God and His messenger. Whenever they are with the latter on some collective errand, they should not leave until they have asked him for permission to do so. Those who do ask you for such permission are the ones who believe in God and His messenger. Whenever they ask you for permission [to attend] to some affair of their own, then give anyone of them you may wish, leave to do so, and seek forgiveness from God for them. God is Forgiving, Merciful.

63.T.B.Irving: Do not treat the Messenger´s bidding you [to do something] just as if one of you were calling out to someone else. God knows which of you try to slip away, aiming to get out of something. Let anyone who opposes his order beware lest some trial afflict them or some painful torment should befall them!

64.T.B.Irving: God possesses whatever is in Heaven and Earth! He knows what you (all) stand for, while He will notify them about whatever they have done on the day they are returned to Him. God is Aware of everything!

1.T.B.Irving: Blessed is the One Who has sent down the Standard to His servant so he may [act as] a warner for [everyone in] the Universe,

2.T.B.Irving: the One Who holds control over Heaven and Earth, Who has not adopted any son nor has He any associate in control. He has created everything and measured it out precisely.

3.T.B.Irving: Instead of Him, they have taken on (other) gods which do not create anything while they themselves have been created. They control no harm nor do they control death nor life, nor even rebirth.

4.T.B.Irving: Those who disbelieve say: "This is only some swindle he has invented; other folk have helped him at it." They have trumped up something wrong and counterfeit.

5.T.B.Irving: They say: "He has had legends by primitive men written down; they are dictated to him in the early morning and evening!"

6.T.B.Irving: SAY: "The One Who knows the secrets of Heaven and Earth has sent it down. He is Forgiving, Merciful."

7.T.B.Irving: Yet they say: "What sort of messenger is this? He eats food and walks through the markets! If only some angel were sent down to him, to act as a warner alongside him!

8.T.B.Irving: Or a treasure were offered him, or a garden belonged to him from which he might eat." Wrongdoers say: "You are only following a man who is bewitched."

9.T.B.Irving: Watch what sort of stories they make up about you; they are lost and cannot find any way back.

10.T.B.Irving: Blessed is the One Who may grant you something even better than that if He so wishes: gardens through which rivers flow. He may even grant you palaces!

11.T.B.Irving: Yet they even deny the Hour. We have prepared a Blaze for anyone who denies the Hour;

12.T.B.Irving: when it appears to them from afar off, they will hear it raging and moaning.

13.T.B.Irving: When they are flung all hitched together into a narrow part of it, they will plead to be blotted out there.

14.T.B.Irving: "Do not plead to be blotted out today once and for all: plead for annihilation many times over!"

15.T.B.Irving: SAY: "Is that best, or the Garden of Immortality which has been promised the heedful?" They are both a reward and a goal for them.

16.T.B.Irving: They will have anything they may wish for in it eternally; it is a promise your Lord will be held responsible for.

17.T.B.Irving: Some day He will summon them along with whatever they have been worshipping instead of God. He will say: "Were you the ones who led these servants of Mine astray, or did they stray away by themselves?"

18.T.B.Irving: They will say: "Glory be to You! We would never take on any patrons besides You! However you let them and their forefathers enjoy things until they forgot the Reminder and became a worthless folk."

19.T.B.Irving: They will reject you in anything you (all) may say, so you will not manage to avert it nor find any support. We shall let any of you who does any wrong taste great torment.

20.T.B.Irving: We have never sent any emissaries before you unless they ate food and walked around the markets. We have placed some of them as a trial for others. Will you be patient while your Lord is Observant?

21.T.B.Irving: Those who do not expect to meet Us say: "Why aren´t angels sent down to us, or we are allowed to see our Lord?" They act too proud of themselves, and strut around quite insolently!

22.T.B.Irving: Some day they shall see the angels! There will be news for criminals on that day and they will say: "Oh, for a stonewall built to protect [us]!"

23.T.B.Irving: We shall advance upon whatever action they have performed and turn it into scattered dust.

24.T.B.Irving: The inhabitants of the Garden will have the best residence and finest lodging on that day,

25.T.B.Irving: on a day when the sky will split open along with its clouds, and the angels will be sent right on down.

26.T.B.Irving: True control will belong to the Mercy-giving on that day. It will be a harsh day for disbelievers,

27.T.B.Irving: a day when the wrongdoer will gnaw away at his hands.

28.T.B.Irving: He will say: "It´s too bad for me! If I had only taken a pathway alongside the Messenger! It´s too bad for me! If I had not adopted So-and-So as a close friend!

29.T.B.Irving: "He led me astray from the Reminder even after it had reached me. Satan is such a turncoat with man. "

30.T.B.Irving: The Messenger will say: "My Lord, my folk assume this Reading is out-of-date.

31.T.B.Irving: Thus have We granted every prophet an enemy among criminals. Yet your Lord suffices as a Guide and Supporter.

32.T.B.Irving: Those who disbelieve say: "Why has not the Quran been sent down to him in one single piece?" [It has been done] like that so your vitals may be braced by it; We have phrased it deliberately.

33.T.B.Irving: They will not come to you with any example unless We will bring you the Truth and something even finer as a commentary.

34.T.B.Irving: Those who are dragged off face down to Hell will be in a worse plight and farthest off the track.

35.T.B.Irving: We gave Moses the Book, and placed Aaron alongside him as a helpmate.

36.T.B.Irving: We said: "Go off to a folk who have denied Our signs." We utterly destroyed them!

37.T.B.Irving: So when Noah´s folk rejected the messengers, We let them drown and set them up as a sign for mankind. We reserve painful torment for wrongdoers

38.T.B.Irving: such as Ad and Thamud and the companions at the Well and many generations in between.

39.T.B.Irving: We have made up parables for each, and each We followed up with doom.

40.T.B.Irving: They have come to the town on which an evil rain poured down. Had they not seen it? Indeed they had not expected to be reborn.

41.T.B.Irving: Whenever they see you, they merely treat you as a laughingstock: "Is this the person whom God has sent as a messenger?

42.T.B.Irving: He almost led us away from our gods, if we had not acted so patient towards them." They will know who is furthest off the track when they see the torment!

43.T.B.Irving: Have you seen someone who has taken his own passion as his god? Would you act as a trustee for him?

44.T.B.Irving: Or do you reckon that most of them do hear or even use their reason? They are just like livestock-indeed, they are even further off the track!

45.T.B.Irving: Have you not seen how your Lord lengthens shadows? If He so wished, He would make them stand still. Then We placed the sun as an indicator for them;

46.T.B.Irving: next We gradually pulled them toward Us.

47.T.B.Irving: He is the One Who has placed night as a garment for you, and sleep for repose; He makes daytime for rising again.

48.T.B.Irving: He is the One Who has sent the winds as heralds announcing His mercy. We send pure water down from the sky,

49.T.B.Irving: so We may bring life to a dead land, and let everything We have created drink from it, such as livestock and men aplenty.

50.T.B.Irving: We have spelled it out for them so they may bear it in mind; yet most men refuse [to do] anything except disbelieve (in it).

51.T.B.Irving: If We had so wished, We might have dispatched a warner into every town.

52.T.B.Irving: Do not obey disbelievers and struggle seriously with them concerning it.

53.T.B.Irving: He is the One Who has cut off both seas, this one being sweet, fresh, while the other is salty, briny. He has placed an isthmus in between them plus a barrier to block them off.

54.T.B.Irving: He is the One Who created humanity out of water; and He has granted them blood ties as well as in-laws. Your Lord has been s Capable!

55.T.B.Irving: Yet instead of God they worship something that neither benefits nor hurts them. The disbeliever will be a backer [for anything against his Lord!

56.T.B.Irving: We have only sent you as a herald and a warner.

57.T.B.Irving: SAY: "I do not ask you for any payment for it except that anyone who wishes to may accept a way unto his Lord.

58.T.B.Irving: Rely on the Living One Who never dies. Hymn His praise! Sufficient is it for Him to be Informed about His servants´ offences,

59.T.B.Irving: since He is the One Who created Heaven and Earth as well as whatever lies in between them, in six days. Then the Mercy-giving mounted on the Throne. Ask any informed (person) about Him."

60.T.B.Irving: When they are told: "Bow down on your knees before the Mercy-giving," they say: "What is the Mercy-giving" Are we to bow down on our knees just because you order us to?" It merely increases their disdain.

61.T.B.Irving: Blessed is the One Who has placed constellations in the sky and set a beacon in it, plus a shining moon!

62.T.B.Irving: He is the One Who has granted night and daytime in succession for anyone who wants to reflect (on it) or wants [to show] gratitude,

63.T.B.Irving: and the Mercy-giving´s servants who walk modestly on earth and peacefully say: "How do you do!" whenever ignorant men address them;

64.T.B.Irving: who spend the night bowing down on their knees and standing before their Lord;

65.T.B.Irving: and who say: "Our Lord, ward off Hell´s torment from us! Its torment is atrocious;

66.T.B.Irving: it is such an evil residence and station;"

67.T.B.Irving: who when they spend, give neither too lavishly nor yet hold back and keep to a happy medium;

68.T.B.Irving: who do not appeal to any other deity besides God [Alone]; nor kill any soul whom God has forbidden [them to] except through [due process of] law; nor misbehave sexually. Anyone who does so will incur a penalty.

69.T.B.Irving: Torment will be doubled for him on Resurrection Day and he will remain disgraced forever in it,

70.T.B.Irving: except for someone who repents and believes, and acts in a honorable manner. God will replace their evil deeds with fine ones, since God is Forgiving, Merciful.

71.T.B.Irving: Anyone who repents and acts honorably should turn to God in repentance,

72.T.B.Irving: and those who will not bear false witness, and when they pass by [people] gossiping, pass by in a dignified manner,

73.T.B.Irving: who whenever they are reminded of their Lord´s signs, do not fall down deaf and blind [when reminded] of them;

74.T.B.Irving: and [rather] who say: "Our Lord, bestow the comfort of our eyes on us in our spouses and our offspring. Make us a model for those who do their duty."

75.T.B.Irving: Those will be rewarded with the Mansion because they have been so patient, and welcomed there with greetings as well as "Peace [be on you]!",

76.T.B.Irving: to live there forever. How fine is such a residence and status!

77.T.B.Irving: SAY: "My Lord will never care about you unless you appeal to Him. Yet since you have rejected [Him], something else will be necessary.

1.T.B.Irving: T.S.M.

2.T.B.Irving: These are verses from the Clear Book.

3.T.B.Irving: Perhaps you are fretting your soul away because they are not believers.

4.T.B.Irving: If We so wished, We might send a sign down to them from Heaven so they would bow their heads submissively before it.

5.T.B.Irving: No Reminder ever comes to them as a renewal from the Mercy-giving except they shun it.

6.T.B.Irving: They have just rejected [it], so news of what they have been ridiculing will soon come to them.

7.T.B.Irving: Have they not looked at the earth [to see] how many generous species We have grown on it?

8.T.B.Irving: In that is a sign; though most of them are not believers.

9.T.B.Irving: Yet your Lord is the Powerful, the Merciful.

10.T.B.Irving: So your Lord summoned Moses: "Go to the wrongdoing folk,

11.T.B.Irving: Pharaoh´s folk! Will they not heed?"

12.T.B.Irving: He said: "My Lord, I fear they will reject me,

13.T.B.Irving: and my breast feels cramped while my tongue will not loosen up. Send for Aaron!

14.T.B.Irving: They have [laid] a charge against me; so I fear they will kill me."

15.T.B.Irving: He said; "Indeed not; let both of you go off with Our signs, We will be listening along with you.

16.T.B.Irving: Go to Pharaoh and say: "We are messengers from the Lord of the Universe.

17.T.B.Irving: Send the Children of Israel off with us!"´

18.T.B.Irving: He said: "Did we not rear you as a child among us and you spent several years of your life with us?

19.T.B.Irving: Yet you committed the deed you did: You are so ungrateful!"

20.T.B.Irving: He said: "I did it while I was misguided.

21.T.B.Irving: I fled from you (all) because I feared you. Still my Lord has bestowed discretion on me and set me up as an emissary.

22.T.B.Irving: Is this some favor you have shown me-that you have enslaved the Children of Israel?"´

23.T.B.Irving: Pharaoh said: "What is the Lord of the Universe?"

24.T.B.Irving: He said: "The Lord of Heaven and Earth and whatever [lies] in between them, if you will be convinced."

25.T.B.Irving: He said to those around him: "Aren´t you listening?"

26.T.B.Irving: He said: "Your Lord and the Lord of your very first forefathers,"

27.T.B.Irving: He said: "Your messenger who has been sent to you is crazy!"

28.T.B.Irving: He said: "[He comes from] the Lord of the East and West, and whatever lies in between them, if you know how to reason."

29.T.B.Irving: He said: "If you should adopt any god besides me, I shall make you a prisoner."

30.T.B.Irving: He said: "Even if I bring you something obvious?"

89.T.B.Irving: Anyone who comes with a fine deed will have something better than it and they will be safe from that day´s terror;

90.T.B.Irving: while anyone who comes with an evil deed will be flung face down into the Fire: "Aren´t you rewarded with just what you´ve been doing?"

91.T.B.Irving: I have only been ordered to serve the Lord of this region which He has hallowed. He possesses everything. I have been ordered to be a Muslim,

92.T.B.Irving: and to recite the Quran. Anyone who is guided, will be guided only for his own sake, while tell anyone who strays away: ´I am merely a warner."

93.T.B.Irving: SAY: "Praise be to God! He will show you His signs so you may recognize them. Your Lord is not overlooking anything you do!"

1.T.B.Irving: T.S.M.

2.T.B.Irving: These are verses from the clear Book!

3.T.B.Irving: We shall recite in all truth to you some information about Moses and Pharaoh for folk who believe.

4.T.B.Irving: Pharaoh had acted haughtily on earth and split his people into factions, seeking to weaken a group of them. He slaughtered their sons and let their women live; he was so depraved!

5.T.B.Irving: Yet We wanted to endow those who were considered inferior on earth, and make them into leaders and make them [Our] heirs.

6.T.B.Irving: We established them on earth and showed Pharaoh and Haman as well as their troops how they should beware of them.

7.T.B.Irving: We inspired Moses´ mother [as follows]: "Nurse him. If you should fear for him, then cast him into the river. Do not fear nor feel sad; We will return him to you, and appoint him as a missionary."

8.T.B.Irving: Pharaoh´s household took him in, so that he became an enemy and [a source of] sadness for them. Pharaoh and Haman as well as their troops were so mistaken!

9.T.B.Irving: Pharaoh´s wife said: "[He´ll be] a comfort for me and for you. Do not kill him! Perhaps he´ll benefit us, or we´ll adopt him as a son." They did not suspect [a thing].

10.T.B.Irving: Next morning the vitals of Moses´ mother felt empty; she almost revealed who he was, if We had not bound up her heart so she would be a believer.

11.T.B.Irving: She told his sister: "Keep track of him." So she watched out for him from a distance while they did not notice it.

12.T.B.Irving: We kept him from nursing at first, and so she said: "Shall I lead you to a family who will look after him for you? They will take good care of him."

13.T.B.Irving: Thus We restored him to his mother so he might comfort her and she would not feel so sad, and so she would know that God´s promise is true, even though most of them do not realize it.

14.T.B.Irving: When he reached maturity and came of age, We gave him discretion and knowledge. Thus We reward those who act kindly.

15.T.B.Irving: He entered the city at a time when its people were lax, and found two men fighting there, one from his own sect and the other from his enemy´s. The one who was from his own faction appealed for his assistance against the one who was from his enemy´s. Moses punched him and he finished him off! He said: "This is some of Satan´s work; he is such an enemy, a plain misleader."

16.T.B.Irving: He said: "My Lord, I have wronged my own soul. Forgive me!" So He forgave him; He is the Forgiving, the Merciful,

17.T.B.Irving: He said: "My Lord, since You have shown me such favor, I shall never back up any criminals [again]."

18.T.B.Irving: Yet he felt fearful next morning in the city; he was on the alert, when the man he had tried to support the day before called out to him for help [again]. Moses told him: "You are clearly a trouble-maker."

19.T.B.Irving: When he wanted to catch the one who was an enemy to them both, he said: "Moses, do you want to kill me just as you killed another person yesterday.? You only want to become a bully on earth; you do not want to be a reformer."

20.T.B.Irving: A man came hurrying up from the further end of the city; he said: "Moses, the councilmen are deliberating about you, whether they should execute you. Clear out! I am giving you sincere advice."

21.T.B.Irving: He left it fearfully, on the alert. He said: "My Lord, save me from such wrongdoing folk!"

22.T.B.Irving: As he made his way towards Midian, he said: "Perhaps my Lord will guide me along some level path."

23.T.B.Irving: When he approached the water of Midian, he found a company of people watering [their flocks] there, and found two women besides them, holding theirs off at a distance. He said: "What´s the matter with you?" They both said: "We may not draw any water until the herdsmen move on. Our father is an elderly gentleman."

24.T.B.Irving: So he did the watering for them. Then he went off to [rest in] the shade, and said: "My Lord, I am poor enough to accept anything You may grant me."

25.T.B.Irving: One of the girls came up to him, walking bashfully. She said: "My father invites you, in order to reward you with some [sort of] payment since you have done the watering for us." When he came up to him, he told him the stories. He said: "Do not fear; you have escaped from wrongdoing folk."

26.T.B.Irving: One of the two (girls) said: "My father, hire him! The best man you can hire is someone who is strong, trustworthy."

27.T.B.Irving: He said: "I want to marry you to one of these daughters of mine, provided you hire yourself out to me for eight seasons. If you should complete ten, then that will be your own affair. I do not want to be hard on you; you will find me an honorable man, if God so wishes."

28.T.B.Irving: He said: "That is up to you and me; whichever term I may serve out, there will be no injustice done to me. God is a Trustee for anything we say."

29.T.B.Irving: When Moses had completed the term [that he had promised to work] and was travelling away with his family, he glimpsed a fire on a slope of Mount [Sinai]. He told his family: "Stay here! I´ve glimpsed a fire. Perhaps I may bring you some news from it, or an ember from the fire so you may warm yourselves."

30.T.B.Irving: So when he came up to it, someone called out to him from the tree in the blessed hollow on the right bank of the valley: "Moses, I am God, Lord of the Universe!"

31.T.B.Irving: And then: "Throw down your staff." When he saw it twitching as if it were possessed, he turned around and tried to escape. "Moses, come closer and do not act afraid. You will be safe!

32.T.B.Irving: Slip your hand into your shirtfront; it will come out white without being harmed. And gather up your courage against any apprehension. These will be two proofs from your Lord for Pharaoh and his councilors; they have been such immoral folk.

33.T.B.Irving: He said: "My Lord, I killed a person among them, and fear they may execute me.

34.T.B.Irving: My brother Aaron is more convincing with his tongue; send him along with me to back me up and vouch for me. I fear they will talk me out of it."

35.T.B.Irving: He said: "We shall strengthen your arm by means of your brother and grant both of you authority so they will not overtake either of you. Because of Our signs, you both will win out, as well as anyone who follows you."

36.T.B.Irving: When Moses brought them Our clear signs, they said: "This is only some contrived magic. We have not heard of this through our early forefathers."

37.T.B.Irving: Moses said: "My Lord is quite Aware as to who brings guidance from His presence and who will attain the Home in the end. Wrongdoers do not succeed."

38.T.B.Irving: Pharaoh said: "Councilmen, I have not known any god for you except myself. Light [a kiln] for me, Haman, for some clay, and build me a tower so I may climb up to Moses´ god. Still I think he´s a liar!"

39.T.B.Irving: Both he and his troops acted overproud on earth without any right [to be so]. They thought they would never return to Us.

40.T.B.Irving: We seized him and his troops and hurled them into the deep. See how the outcome was for wrongdoers!

41.T.B.Irving: We turned them into leaders who invite [men] to the Fire. On Resurrection Day they will not be supported.

42.T.B.Irving: We shall let a curse follow them in this world, while on Resurrection Day they will look hideous.

43.T.B.Irving: We gave Moses the Book after We had wiped out the earliest generations [to serve] as insights for mankind, and for guidance and mercy so they might bear it in mind.

44.T.B.Irving: You [Muhammad], were not (present) on the western slope when We settled the matter for Moses, nor were you a witness;

45.T.B.Irving: but We raised up some generations, and [their] lifetime was prolonged for them. Nor were you a resident among the people of Midian, reciting Our signs to them, but We were [to send] emissaries.

46.T.B.Irving: You were not on the slope of Mount [Sinai] when We called out, but [have been sent] as a mercy from your Lord so you might warn a folk whom no warner had come to before you, so that they might bear it in mind.

47.T.B.Irving: If only some calamity would strike them because of what [evil] their hands have sent on ahead, and so they would say: "Our Lord, if only you had sent us some messenger, we should have followed Your signs and been believers!"

48.T.B.Irving: Yet when the Truth did come to them from Our presence, they said: "If he were only given the same as Moses was given!" Still had they not already disbelieved in what Moses was given? They say: "Double magic, to back each other up!" And they say: "We disbelieve in everything."

49.T.B.Irving: SAY: "Bring a book from God´s presence which will be a better guide than either of them so I may follow it if you are that truthful."

50.T.B.Irving: If they do not respond to you, then know they are merely following their own whims. Who is more misguided than someone who follows his own whim without having any guidance from God? God does not guide wrongdoing folk."

51.T.B.Irving: We have conveyed the Statement to them so they might keep it in mind.

52.T.B.Irving: The ones We gave the Book to previously believe in it;

53.T.B.Irving: whenever it is recited to them, they say: "We believe in it; it is the Truth from our Lord! We have already committed ourselves to [live in] peace."

54.T.B.Irving: Those will be given their payment twice over because of what they have endured; they ward off evil with good and spend some of what We have provided them with.

55.T.B.Irving: Whenever they hear any gossip, they shun it and say: "We hold to our actions while you have your actions." Peace be upon you! We do not hanker after ignorant people."

56.T.B.Irving: You do not guide someone you love, but God guides anyone He wishes. He is quite Aware as to who are guided.

57.T.B.Irving: They say: "If we followed guidance along with you, we´d be swept out of our land." Yet have We not established a safe haven for them where produce of every sort is brought from Our presence as sustenance? However most of them do not realize it.

58.T.B.Irving: How many towns have We wiped out who were reckless in their way of livings Those dwellings of theirs have been inhabited only occasionally since then. We have been [their] heirs!

59.T.B.Irving: Your Lord has never been the destroyer of any towns unless He had dispatched a messenger to their capital city who recited Our signs to them. Nor did We ever destroy any towns unless their people became wrongdoers.

60.T.B.Irving: Anything you have been given is for enjoyment and as an attraction during worldly life. Yet what God has is better and more lasting. Will you not use your reason?

61.T.B.Irving: Is someone We have made a handsome promise to and who will receive it, like someone whom We have allowed to enjoy worldly life, then will be made to appear on Resurrection Day?

62.T.B.Irving: Some day He will call out to them and say: "Where are My associates whom you have been claiming."

63.T.B.Irving: The ones against whom the Sentence will be pronounced will say: "Our Lord, those are the people whom we have misled! We misled them just as we ourselves went astray. We absolve ourselves before You; it was not we whom they worshipped."

64.T.B.Irving: Someone will say: "Appeal to your associates!" So they will appeal to them, yet they will not answer them. They will see the Torment-if only they had accepted guidance!

65.T.B.Irving: Some day He will call out to them and say: "How did you answer the emissaries?"´

66.T.B.Irving: The news will seem confusing to them on that day, and they will not [be able to] question one another.

67.T.B.Irving: Yet anyone who repented, believed and acted honorably may possibly be among those who are successful.

68.T.B.Irving: Your Lord creates and chooses anything He wishes; while they have no choice. Praise be to God; Exalted is He over anything they may associate with Him!

69.T.B.Irving: Your Lord knows anything their breasts conceal and anything they may disclose.

70.T.B.Irving: He is God [Alone]; there is no deity except Him! Praise belongs to Him from the very first as well as in the Hereafter. Discretion is His, and to Him will you (all) return.

71.T.B.Irving: SAY: "Have you considered, if God should lay perpetual night over you until Resurrection Day, what deity besides God would bring you any radiance? Will you not listen?"

72.T.B.Irving: SAY: "Have you considered whether if God should lay perpetual daylight over you until Resurrection Day, what deity other than God would bring you night wherein you might find rest? Will you not observe [these things]?

73.T.B.Irving: "Out of His mercy He has granted you night and daytime so you may rest in the one and seek some of His bounty [in the other], and so that you may feel grateful."

74.T.B.Irving: Some day He will call out to them and say: "Where are My associates whom you have been claiming?"

75.T.B.Irving: We shall drag a witness out of every nation and We shall say: ´Bring on your proof!" They will realize that Truth belongs to God while whatever they were inventing has left them in the lurch.

76.T.B.Irving: Quran belonged to Moses´ folk, and he acted insolently towards them. We gave him such treasures that his keys [alone) would have overburdened a squad of strong men. So his people told him: "Don´t act so happy, for God does not love people who are too happy.

77.T.B.Irving: Seek a home in the Hereafter through whatever God has given you. Do not neglect your share in this world, and act kindly, just as God has treated you kindly. Do not aim to cause mischief on earth; God does not love mischief makers."

78.T.B.Irving: He said: "I have been given it only because of some knowledge I possess." Did he not realize that God had wiped out generations before him who were stronger than he and possessed even greater resources? Will not criminals be questioned concerning their offences?

79.T.B.Irving: He went forth to his folk [dressed] in his finery. Those who wanted worldly life said: "If we only had the same as Quran has been given! He has been extremely lucky!"

80.T.B.Irving: However those who had been given knowledge said: "It will be too bad for you! God´s recompense is better for anyone who believes and acts honorably. Yet only the patient will encounter it."

81.T.B.Irving: Then We let the earth swallow up him and his home. He did not have any party to support him against God; he was not supported.

82.T.B.Irving: Those who longed to be in his place the day before, said the next morning: "Since it is God Who extends sustenance to anyone He wishes from among His servants and measures it out, it would have swallowed us up too if God had not cared for us. It seems that disbelievers do not prosper.

83.T.B.Irving: That home in the Hereafter will We grant to those who want neither haughtiness nor any corruption on earth. The outcome belongs to those who do their duty.

84.T.B.Irving: Anyone who brings a fine deed will have something even better than it, while anyone who comes with an evil deed [will find that] those who perform evil deeds will not be rewarded except for whatever they have been doing.

85.T.B.Irving: The One Who has charged you with the Reading will return you to [your] destination. SAY: "My Lord is quite Aware as to who has brought guidance and who is in plain error."

86.T.B.Irving: You did not expect that the Book would be delivered to you except as a mercy from your Lord.

87.T.B.Irving: Do not let it distract you [observing] God´s signs once they have been sent down to you. I [people to meet] your Lord and do not be an associator;

88.T.B.Irving: do appeal to any other deity along with God: there is no god except Him. Everything is perishable except His face! Discretion belongs to Him, and to Him will you (all) be returned.

1.T.B.Irving: A.L.M.

2.T.B.Irving: Do people reckon that they will be left alone just because they say: "We believe," and they will not be tested?

3.T.B.Irving: We have tested the ones who preceded them. God knows the ones who are truthful and He will recognize liars.

4.T.B.Irving: Or do the ones who perform evil deeds reckon they will get ahead of Us? How badly do they judge!

5.T.B.Irving: God´s deadline is coming for anyone who has been expecting to meet God! He is the Alert, Aware.

6.T.B.Irving: Anyone who strives, strives only for his own soul´s sake. God is Transcendent, beyond [any need of] the Universe!

7.T.B.Irving: We will overlook their evil deeds, and reward them with the finest of whatever they have been doing.

8.T.B.Irving: We have instructed everyman to treat his parents kindly. Yet if they should strive to make you associate anything with Me which you have no knowledge of, do not obey them! To Me shall be your return, and I will notify you about anything you have been doing.

9.T.B.Irving: We will let the ones who believe and perform honorable deeds enter in among honorable people.

10.T.B.Irving: There are some people who say: "We believe in God"; yet whenever they suffer abuse for God´s sake, they maintain that any trials by mankind are like God´s torment. If any support should come from your Lord, they would say: "We have stood alongside you." Is God not quite Aware of what is on the minds of [everybody in] the Universe?

11.T.B.Irving: God does recognize those who believe and He (also) recognizes hypocrites.

12.T.B.Irving: Those who disbelieve tell those who believe: "Follow our course and we will assume [responsibility for] your mistakes." They will not assume their mistakes in any way: they are such liars!

13.T.B.Irving: However they will carry their own loads and others´ loads besides their own. They will be questioned on Resurrection Day about what they have invented.

14.T.B.Irving: We sent Noah to his folk. He remained among them for a thousand years less fifty twelvemonths. The Flood seized them while they were doing wrong.

15.T.B.Irving: However We saved him and the companions in the ship, and made it into a sign for [everyone in] the Universe.

16.T.B.Irving: Next Abraham told his folk: "Serve God and heed Him. That will be best for you if you only realized it.

17.T.B.Irving: You serve only images instead of God, and create a sham. The ones you serve instead of God do not control any sustenance for you, so seek sustenance from God Himself and serve Him; act grateful towards Him; to Him will you be returned.

18.T.B.Irving: "Yet if you should deny it - and nations before you have already denied such-the Messenger has only to deliver [his message] clearly.

19.T.B.Irving: Have they not seen how God begins with creation, then performs it all over again? That is so easy for God [to do]!"

20.T.B.Irving: SAY: "Travel around the earth and see how He began with creation; later on God raises up fresh growth. God is Capable of everything!

21.T.B.Irving: He punishes anyone He wishes to and shows mercy to anyone He wishes; to Him will you be restored.

22.T.B.Irving: You cannot prevent anything [from happening] on earth nor in Heaven; you have no patron nor any supporter besides God."

23.T.B.Irving: Those who reject God´s signs and [any hope of] meeting Him despair of My mercy; those will have painful torment.

24.T.B.Irving: There was no answer from his folk except they said: "Kill him or bum him up!" Yet God saved him from the fire; in that are signs for folk who believe.

25.T.B.Irving: He said: "You have merely adopted images instead of God, out of affection for one another during worldly life. Then on Resurrection Day some of you will disown one another while others of you will curse each other. Your refuge will be the Fire; you will have no supporters!"

26.T.B.Irving: Lot believed in him and he said: "I will move elsewhere for my Lord´s sake. He is the Powerful, the Wise."

27.T.B.Irving: We bestowed Isaac and Jacob on him, and granted prophethood and the Book to his offspring. We gave him his payment in this world while in the Hereafter he will be among the honorable.

28.T.B.Irving: So Lot told his folk: "You indulge in such sexual misconduct as no one in the Universe has attempted before you.

29.T.B.Irving: You even accost men and intercept [them on] the highway! You commit such a horrible thing in your clubs." * His folk´s answer was merely to say: "Bring us God´s torment if you are so truthful!"

30.T.B.Irving: He said: "My Lord, support me against such degenerate folk!"

31.T.B.Irving: When Our messengers brought Abraham the good news, they said: "We´ll destroy the people of this town. Its people have been doing wrong."

32.T.B.Irving: He said: "Yet Lot is in it!" They said: "We are quite aware as to who is in it. We´ll save both him and his household, except for his wife; she is one of those who will stay behind."

33.T.B.Irving: When Our messengers came to Lot, he felt wretched because of them, for [his] ability to protect them was so slender. They said: "Do not fear nor feel so sad. We shall save you and your family, except for your wife; she will be one of those who will stay behind.

34.T.B.Irving: We are sending a blight down from Heaven upon the people of this town because they have been acting so depraved."

35.T.B.Irving: We have left some of it as a clear sign for folk who will [use their powers of] reason.

36.T.B.Irving: To Midian [was sent] their brother Shuayb. He said: "My folk, serve God and await the Last Day. Do not cause such mischief that it will ruin the earth."

37.T.B.Irving: They rejected him, so the Tremor seized them, and one morning they lay cowering in their home.

38.T.B.Irving: Both Ad and Thumad have been explained to you by means of their [empty] dwellings; Satan made their actions seem attractive to them and he diverted them from the Way even though they had been granted insight.

39.T.B.Irving: [In the case of] Quran, Pharaoh and Haman, Moses brought them explanations and they [still] acted overbearing on earth; yet they could never get ahead [of Us].

40.T.B.Irving: Each We seized for his offence; some of them We sent a hailstorm against, some the Blast overtook, others of them We let the earth swallow up, while still others We drowned. It was not God Who wronged them, but they had already wronged themselves.

41.T.B.Irving: Those who enlist other patrons instead of God may be compared to the Spider, who adopts a house for himself. The flimsiest house is the Spider´s house, if they only realized it!

42.T.B.Irving: God knows anything they may appeal to besides Himself; He is the Powerful, the Wise.

43.T.B.Irving: These are parables We make up for mankind, though only the learned will use their [powers of] reason.

44.T.B.Irving: God created Heaven and Earth in [all] Truth; in that is a sign for believers!

45.T.B.Irving: Recite whatever has been revealed to you from the Book, and keep up prayer: prayer restrains one from sexual misconduct and debauchery. Yet mentioning God is even more important, for God knows whatever you produce.

46.T.B.Irving: Do not argue with the People of the Book unless It is in the poutest manner, except for those of them who do wrong. SAY: "We believe in what has been sent down to us and what has been sent down to you. Our God and your God is [the Same] One, and we are committed to [observe] peace before Him.

47.T.B.Irving: Thus We have sent you down the Book. The ones whom We have given the Book to believe in it. Some of those are [people] who believe in it; only disbelievers repudiate Our signs.

48.T.B.Irving: You had not been reciting any book previously nor did you copy it down with your right hand; otherwise quibblers would suspect it.

49.T.B.Irving: Rather it exists as clear signs in the breasts of those who have been given knowledge. Only wrongdoers repudiate Our signs.

50.T.B.Irving: They say: "If only some signs were sent down to him from his Lord!" SAY: "Signs rest only with God; I am merely a plain warner."

51.T.B.Irving: Is it not sufficient for them that We have sent you down the Book to be recited to them? In that lies mercy plus a Reminder for folk who believe.
